title: Urban Development Grant (UDG) - Belfast
additional_information:
Projects which may attract funding include physical developments to:

  • commercial or retail premises
  • light industrial plants
  • inner-city housing
eligibility:
Projects must be located in Neighbourhood Renewal Areas (see website for further details).

Projects must show that they can not go ahead without the Urban Development Grant.
evaluation: The ratio of the applicants' investments to public spend will be an important factor in the appraisal of projects.
long_description: Provides discretionary grants for the development of vacant, derelict or underused land and buildings. The scheme aims to promote job creation, inward investment and environmental improvement.
short_description: Grants for the development of vacant, derelict and underused land or buildings
contact_details: Belfast Regeneration Office bro@dsdni.gov.uk 02890 819 654 James House 2-4 Cromac Avenue Gasworks Business Park Ormeau Road Belfast BT7 2JA

title: Access to Work - London
eligibility: Disabled employees and their employers are eligible to apply for grants under this scheme.
long_description: This scheme provides grants to employers towards extra employment costs which result from an employee having a disability. The programme aims to provide practical advice and support to disabled people and their employers, in order to overcome work related obstacles which result from disability.
short_description: Grants and practical advice for disabled people and their employers to help overcome the practical problems resulting from disability
contact_details: Jobcentre Plus atwosu.london@jobcentreplus.gsi.gov.uk 020 8426 3110 Access to Work Operational Support Nine Elms Lane London SW95 9BH

title: Co-operative and Community Finance
additional_information: The scheme also offers free business advice.
eligibility: Applicants must be looking to start, expand or take over a co-operative, employee owned business or social enterprise.
evaluation:
Applicants must provide:

  • a completed application form
  • a detailed business plan
  • membership, constitution and management structure details
  • audited accounts or financial requirements
long_description:
This scheme encourages workers to collectively own and manage the company they work for. Funds may be used to:

  • buy out existing company owners
  • purchase premises or equipment
  • replace inappropriate funding
  • provide working capital
organiser: Co-operative and Community Finance Head Office
short_description: Finance for workers' co-operatives and community businesses
will_continue_on: Co-operative and Community Finance Head Office website
contact_details: Co-operative and Community Finance Head Office info@co-operativeandcommunityfinance.coop 01179 166 750 Brunswick Court Brunswick Square Bristol BS2 8PE

title: Year in Industry
additional_information:
A one off charge of £1,950 + VAT per student which covers:

  • all recruitment issues
  • a pre-interview by The Year in Industry staff
  • on going support and training throughout the year
eligibility: Businesses must be located in the UK and agree to provide the student with competitive pay, real work experience and full support throughout the year. They must also accept the extra training provided, which may be on a day release system.
long_description: This scheme provides businesses with assistance in recruiting students for gap year placements. Companies can benefit from an inexpensive way of employing high quality staff without the need for long-term employment, as well as the first link to potential graduate recruits.
short_description: Helps businesses to recruit students for gap year placements
contact_details: Year In Industry 023 8059 7061 University of Southampton Southampton SO17 1BJ

title: The Queen's Awards for Enterprise - Innovation
additional_information:
Achievements may be assessed for any of the following:

  • invention, design, production of goods
  • performance of services
  • marketing, distribution and after sale support of goods or services
eligibility:
Businesses must:

  • be based in the UK and employ at least two full-time employees
  • demonstrate substantial improvement in business performance and commercial success
long_description:
Annual awards to recognise and reward UK companies that have developed commercially successful innovative products or services. Businesses may apply under the following criteria:

  • outstanding innovation sustained over two years or more
  • continuous innovation sustained over two years or more
short_description: Gives businesses the chance to compete for an award acknowledging significant achievement in innovation
contact_details: The Queen's Award Office info@queensawards.org.uk 020 7222 2277 151 Buckingham Palace Road London SW1H 0ET

title: The Queen's Awards for Enterprise - International Trade
additional_information:
Businesses may enter on the following criteria:

  • outstanding achievement resulting in substantial growth in overseas earnings, sustained over three years or more
  • continuous achievement resulting in substantial growth in overseas earnings, sustained over six years or more
eligibility: Businesses must be operating regularly as a unit of the UK economy and have achieved a minimum of £100,000 sales each year of their application.
long_description: This annual award recognises export achievement and outstanding performance in international trading.
short_description: Recognises outstanding achievements in overseas earnings by UK businesses
contact_details: The Queen's Award Office info@queensawards.org.uk 020 7222 2277 151 Buckingham Palace Road London SW1H 0ET

title: The Queen's Awards for Enterprise - Sustainable Development
additional_information:
Achievements should be in some or all of the following:

  • the invention, design, and production of goods
  • the performance of services
  • the marketing, distribution and after sale support of goods or services
  • the management of resources and relationships with people or organisations
eligibility: Businesses must be based in the UK and employ at least two full-time employees.
evaluation:
Businesses may enter to be evaluated on:

  • outstanding achievement over a period of two years or more
  • continuous achievement over a period of five years or more
long_description: This annual award recognises companies which have integrated environmental, social, economic and management aspects of sustainable development into their business.
short_description: Recognises commercially successful products, services and approaches to management which might benefit the environment, society and the wider economy
contact_details: The Queen's Award Office info@queensawards.org.uk 020 7222 2277 151 Buckingham Palace Road London SW1H 0ET

title: Small Business Assistance Grant - Inverclyde
eligibility:
Businesses must:

  • supply a business plan and financial projections
  • have a clearly defined market
  • be based in Inverclyde
  • investigate banks and traditional sources of finance prior to application
long_description: Financial assistance available to businesses in Inverclyde for capital expenditure projects that will stimulate business growth.
short_description: Grant support for small and medium-sized businesses in Inverclyde
contact_details: Inverclyde Council eds.enquiries@inverclyde.gov.uk 01475 715 555 Business Store 75 - 81 Cathcart Street Greenock PA15 1DE

title: Work Trials
additional_information:
Some categories of jobseeker may be allowed early access to the programme, including people with disabilities and ex-offenders.

Individuals must usually be aged 25 or over and have been unemployed for six months or more.
eligibility:
Businesses must be located in the UK and have a job vacancy that is for 16 hours or more per week.

Jobseekers must meet the eligibility conditions.
long_description:
This scheme offers work trials for unemployed people with employers for up to 15 working days, enabling them to show what they are capable of doing.

Individuals continue to receive their benefits and are paid travel expenses and a meal allowance of £3.00 per day.
short_description: Encourages businesses to recruit unemployed people
contact_details: Jobcentre Plus 0845 601 2001 Level 2 Rockingham House 123 West Street Sheffield S1 4ER

title: Advisory Services - Fermanagh
eligibility: New and established businesses based in the Fermanagh district may apply.
long_description:
Businesses based in Fermanagh can obtain free, confidential advice and information from accredited business advisers. Businesses with more specific enquiries can access consultancy services to assist with issues such as:

  • business plans
  • marketing plans
  • market research studies
  • feasibility studies
  • recruitment
  • implementation of quality management systems
short_description: Support and guidance to pre-start, start-up and growth businesses in Fermanagh
contact_details: Fermanagh Enterprise Limited info@fermanaghenterprise.com 028 6632 7348 Enniskillen Business Centre Lackaghboy Industrial Estate Enniskillen Fermanagh BT74 4RL

title: SIGNAL Centre of Business Excellence - North Down
eligibility: Small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) located in North Down may apply.
long_description:
Developing businesses can access advice and support to assist with a wide range of topics and concerns, including:

  • networking
  • e-business
  • facilities for hire
  • market research
short_description: Support for developing businesses in North Down
contact_details: Signal Business Growth Centre signalbusiness@northdown.gov.uk 028 9147 3788 2 Innotec Drive Balloo Road Bangor BT19 7PD

title: Business Mentoring - Scotland
additional_information:
This service is provided free to businesses and social enterprises.

The website has information on how mentors have helped other businesses and customers experiences of the service.
eligibility: This service is for growing businesses and social enterprises based in Scotland.
long_description:
The Business Mentoring service is a partnership between Scottish Enterprise and Scottish Chamber of Commerce, with funding support from the European Regional Development Fund. The service provides experienced mentors that can encourage and help growing companies and social enterprises to develop and explore opportunities.

Business mentors share their insights, knowledge, experiences and provide an objective, impartial view of businesses to help business leaders review their goals and plans.

This can help businesses:

  • develop key business knowledge and skills
  • improve problem-solving abilities
  • address barriers to growing their business
  • widen their network of business contacts

An experienced mentor can also help businesses enhance their ability to boost profitability and productivity and develop new opportunities such as entering new markets, launching new products or improving customer service.
short_description: Mentoring support for businesses based in Scotland
contact_details: Business Mentoring Scotland admin@businessmentoringscotland.org 0845 609 6622 Scottish Chambers of Commerce Business Mentoring 30 George Square Glasgow G2 1EQ

title: Professional and Career Development Loans
long_description:
Professional and Career Development Loans are a deferred repayment bank loan set at a competitively low interest rate that can be used to help individuals gain training and qualifications to improve their job skills or even launch a new career or profession.

Professional and Career Development Loans are a competitive commercial bank loan which learners can use to pay for work-related learning.

The Young People's Learning Agency (YPLA) will pay the interest on the loan whilst the learner is in learning and for up to one month afterwards. Learners must then start to repay the loan when they finish studying, whether or not they complete their course or get a job.
short_description: Loans to help individuals pay for vocational learning or education
contact_details: Young People's Learning Agency 0800 100 900 Capacity Building Learner Support The Straddle Victoria Quays Sheffield S2 5SY

title: Innovators Counselling and Advisory Service - Scotland
eligibility: Available to small businesses and inventive individuals located in Scotland, who wish to place their ideas into the marketplace.
long_description: The service offers guidance on intellectual property rights and signposting to other sources of assistance. Funding, training and business planning advice is also available.
short_description: Innovation support for Scottish companies
contact_details: Glasgow Opportunities (GO) 0141 222 9580 2nd Floor Mercantile Chambers 53 Bothwell Street Glasgow G2 6TS

title: SAB Development Grants - Aberdeenshire
additional_information: Fishing and agriculture are not covered by the scheme, but agricultural diversification projects are covered.
eligibility:
The following factors must be covered in any application:

  • the additional economic benefit for Aberdeenshire
  • demonstration of the viability of the proposal
  • potential for additional employment
  • the effect of the proposal on existing local businesses
  • the real need for top-up finance
long_description:
Grants are available to assist companies in Aberdeenshire with:

  • non-statutory training
  • research and development
  • market development
  • implementation of a recognised quality system
  • viability assessment and establishment of community businesses
  • exhibiting at an exhibition or trade show outside North East Scotland
short_description: Grants for business development projects in Aberdeenshire
contact_details: Aberdeenshire Council business.support@aberdeenshire.gov.uk 01224 665 218 Woodhill House Westburn Road Aberdeen AB16 5GB

title: SAB Rental Grants - Aberdeenshire
additional_information: Fishing and agriculture are not covered by the scheme, but agricultural diversification projects will be considered.
eligibility:
The following factors must be covered in any application:

  • the additional economic benefit for Aberdeenshire
  • demonstration of the viability of the proposal
  • potential for additional employment
  • the effect of the proposal on existing local businesses
  • the real need for top-up finance
long_description: Grants are available for the rental of industrial premises where at least five permanent jobs are being created at any one time.

title: Rural Shop Support Scheme - Aberdeenshire
additional_information:
Assistance may be available for the following:

  • improvements and extensions to shop layout and fixtures
  • schemes to improve the internal or external appearance of the shop
  • promotion of operations which would help the overall viability of the shop
eligibility:
Assistance is focused on shops and/or Post Offices that are the sole permanent provider of everyday products in a rural community.

Consideration will be given in certain circumstances in areas with two outlets where a clear need exists. The scheme is open to individuals intending to open a new shop in area where no such facility exists. Mobile shops may also be eligible.
long_description:
Grants are available to help with the development and diversification of rural shops in Aberdeenshire. The scheme provides:

  • business counselling
  • specialist consultancy
  • training advice
  • grant assistance
short_description: Grants for rural shops in Aberdeenshire
contact_details: Aberdeenshire Council business.support@aberdeenshire.gov.uk 01224 665 218 Woodhill House Westburn Road Aberdeen AB16 5GB

title: Skills and Business Growth Programme - Glasgow
eligibility:
Businesses must:

  • be operating from business premises within Glasgow City Council's boundary
  • generate more than 50 per cent of turnover from outwith Glasgow or
  • generate more than 50 per cent of their turnover from manufacturing

Retail businesses are not eligible.
long_description:
The Skills and Business Growth Programme is a training grant designed to help businesses in Glasgow provide higher level management and technical skills for employees, manager and owners.

The programme seeks to improve the competitiveness of Glasgow Business by helping businesses provide formal training of a high standard for all members of the workforce thereby improving their productivity and employability.
short_description: Training grants for businesses in Glasgow

The following factors must be covered in any application:

  • demonstration of the viability of the proposal
  • potential for additional employment
  • the effect of the proposal on existing local businesses
  • the real need for top-up finance
evaluation:
There are two stages to the grant procedure:

  • an audit by an approved consultant, with recommendations for any necessary changes
  • financial assistance with the implementation of these recommendations
long_description: Grants are available to encourage businesses to install environmentally sustainable processes. In addition, the grant is available to encourage good practice in areas such as using renewable energy, waste management, efficient use of resources, recycling and establishing sustainable working practices. The grant is also available for the installation of equipment.
short_description: Grants to encourage environmentally friendly business practices

It is partly funded by the European Regional Development Fund, alongside approved professional private sector equity investors. The following factors must be covered in any application:

  • the additional economic benefit for Aberdeenshire

eligibility:
Businesses based in the Highlands Council area may apply. Ineligible industries include:

  • agriculture
  • fisheries

evaluation:
Businesses must demonstrate:

This scheme provides low-interest loans to assist new and growing businesses in the Highlands which have failed to secure funding from traditional sources. Eligible costs include:

title: Crofting Counties Agricultural Grants Scheme - Scotland
eligibility: Please see the website for eligibility criteria.
long_description:
The Crofting Counties Agricultural Grants Scheme (CCAGS) provides assistance towards improving and sustaining the viability of croft business. In doing this it also helps achieve other benefits such as improved animal health and welfare.

The principle objective of CCAGS is to sustain the economic basis and way of life and so help retain population in crofting areas.

Support is available to eligible applicants for land improvement, agricultural buildings, access and facilities for keeping livestock.
organiser: Scottish Government Environment and Rural Affairs Department
short_description: Grants for a range of crofting activities
will_continue_on: Scottish Government Environment and Rural Affairs Department website
contact_details: Scottish Government Rural Payments and Inspections Directorate (SGRPID) SGRPID.Ayr@scotland.gsi.gov.uk 0129 2291 300 Russell House King Street KA8 0BE

title: Enterprise Fellowships - Scotland
additional_information: Residents in the Highlands and Islands area should contact the Highlands and Islands Enterprise Agency (HIE).
eligibility: 'The scheme is intended for researchers, post graduates and recently graduated students based in academia or the private sector.
long_description:
The scheme is a programme providing support for researchers who wish to develop a science or technology based idea into a successful company and take a lead role in that company. The programme provides:

  • a year's salary to develop the commercial proposition and product
  • business training to assist in preparing a business plan
  • access to networks of mentors, business experts and professional advisors
short_description: Advice for those developing technological ideas
contact_details: Scottish Enterprise network.helpline@scotent.co.uk 0141 228 2056 Atrium Court 50 Waterloo Street Glasgow G2 6HQ

title: Proof of Concept Programme - Scotland
additional_information: Please see website for more details.
eligibility:
Entrepreneurs working in Scottish universities, research institutes and NHS Boards are eligible to apply.

The programme is also open to universities in the Highlands and Islands area. Residents in the Highlands and Islands area should contact the Highlands and Islands Enterprise Agency (HIE).
long_description:
Entrepreneurs can obtain financial support to assist them in funding the development of early stage product and process ideas.

The Proof of Concept Programme is partly funded by the European Union. It typically supports high-risk projects with the potential to develop into successful businesses or license innovative new technologies.
short_description: Finance to support the development of early stage ideas
contact_details: Scottish Enterprise network.helpline@scotent.co.uk 0141 228 2593 Atrium Court 50 Waterloo Street Glasgow G2 6HQ

title: Creative Scotland
additional_information: Creative Scotland offers an investment open line and investment surgeries which enable potential applicants to speak with staff. They will be able to receive face-to-face tailored assistance with their inquiries about the investment programmes. Please see website for more information.
eligibility: Each programme has specific eligibility criteria. Contact Creative Scotland for information about eligibility.
long_description:
Creative Scotland is the national development body for the arts, screen and creative industries in Scotland.

Creative Scotland develops and invests in Scotland's arts sector at home and abroad. They invest in areas such as quality artistic productions and audience access and participation.

Creative Scotland offers a range of investment opportunities, which support both organisations and individuals. There are a number of investment programmes as follows:

  • Access, Audience Development and Participation Programme
  • Capital Programme
  • Cultural Economy Programme
  • Film and Broadcasting Fund
  • Foundation Organisations and Flexibly Funded Organisations
  • Innovation Fund
  • International Programme
  • National Events 2012/14
  • Networks and Agencies
  • Place
  • Quality Arts Production
  • Talent Development
  • Touring, Festivals and Events
  • Youth Music Initiative

Please see website for more details on any of these programmes.
short_description: Grants for individual artists and art organisations in Scotland
contact_details: Creative Scotland enquiries@creativescotland.com 0845 603 6000 Waverley Gate 2-4 Waterloo Place Edinburgh EH1 3EG

title: PSYBT Growth Fund Development Loan
additional_information:
The loan is not to be used to replace capital equipment.

The loan must not be used to buy premises previously leased by the applicant.

The loan must not be used for rescue funding.

Growth plans should be able to demonstrate ability to achieve profitable growth of at least 25 per cent in turnover.
eligibility:
Eligible applicants must:

  • have received Prince's Scottish Youth Business Trust support
  • be between 18 and 29 years old
  • have been established in business for at least one year
  • be unable to raise the finance elsewhere
evaluation: Applicants must provide up-to-date financial records and a viable business plan.

title: Coalfields Enterprise Fund - North West England
additional_information: Check with organisers for further details of eligible locations.
eligibility:
Businesses based in the North West may be eligible. Businesses based outside the region may apply if:

  • they employ a proportion of their workforce from the region
  • they use suppliers based in the area
long_description:
The Coalfields Funds, managed by EV, offer up to £33 million of commercial equity funding to new and existing SMEs, with the aim of supporting the growth of businesses and encouraging entrepreneurship in England's former coalfield regions.

The Coalfields Funds are able to offer investment of up to £1 million in the form of equity and equity-related funding and are flexible in their approach. Companies at any stage in their development may apply for investment from the Funds, from start ups and early stage companies, to ongoing development capital and management buy-outs and buy-ins of more established businesses.
short_description: Venture capital for businesses in England's former coalfield areas
contact_details: Enterprise Ventures Limited info@evgroup.uk.com 01772 270 570 Preston Technology Management Ctr Marsh Lane Preston Lancashire PR1 8UQ

long_description: This scheme offers venture capital to new and existing growth-orientated businesses in the coalfield areas of Kent.
short_description: Venture capital for businesses in England's former coalfield areas

  • be available to the general public

title: Waterborne Freight Grant (WFG) - Scotland
eligibility: Any company wishing to move freight by rail or water which results in the removal of freight from roads in GB may apply.
long_description: The scheme assists companies with the operating costs, for up to three years, of moving freight by water where road is the cheaper option. Applicants need to demonstrate that the proposed service will be able to operate without grant support within 3 years. This scheme is open to coastal and short-sea shipping movements only - inland waterway movements receive support through the MSRS (Bulk and Waterways) scheme.
short_description: Grants for moving freight by water rather than road
contact_details: Scottish Government - Transport Scotland 0131 244 1526 Aviation, Maritime, Freight, Canals Area 2G (North) Victoria Quay Edinburgh EH6 6QQ

title: Research and Development Tax Credit for Small and Medium-Sized Enterprises (SMEs) - Croydon
additional_information:
Some SMEs which are not in profit can surrender their research and development tax losses for cash, if they have paid PAYE/National Insurance during the year.

The Croydon office covers applications from parts of London and the South East. For a complete list of postcodes covered please see the website.
eligibility:
The applicant must:

  • be involved in a project which is seeking to advance science or technology through the resolution of scientific or technological uncertainty
  • spend over £10,000 per year on research and development
evaluation: Companies should refer to the information provided on the HM Revenue & Customs website and contact their local tax office for advice.
long_description: This scheme offers extra tax deductions to small or medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) involved in research and development.
short_description: Tax deductions for SMEs for research and development
contact_details: HM Revenue & Customs 020 8633 4307 Southern House Wellesley Grove Croydon CR9 1WW

title: Innovation Unit
long_description:
The scheme provides support to businesses looking to introduce innovative measure into their business. It will support applications that can show:

  • evidence of why they believe their proposal could raise educational standards
  • the likely effect of the proposal on all of the pupils and students who may be affected
  • that there would be no detrimental effect on pupils or students with special educational needs
short_description: Innovative solutions for delivering public services
contact_details: Innovation Unit contact@innovationunit.org 020 7250 8098 49 - 51 East Road London N1 6AH

title: Business Enterprise Fund - Bradford
additional_information: The Bradford Enterprise Fund can also offer top-up finance.
eligibility: Businesses based in Bradford who have been refused other sources of finance.
evaluation: The loan must be used for the purpose of starting a new business or expanding an existing business. The loan cannot be used to fund past debts.
long_description: The Bradford Enterprise Fund is for entrepreneurs who are unable to access mainstream finance to start or develop a business.
short_description: Financial support for new businesses in Bradford
contact_details: Business Enterprise Fund info@befund.org 01274 207 217 Devere House Vicar Lane Little Germany Bradford West Yorkshire BD1 5AH

title: Export Support - Yorkshire
long_description:
Advises small businesses in expanding their company overseas, this advice includes:

  • practical support for the companies in the identification and exploration of opportunities in global markets
  • information about markets, cultures and competitors
  • market research exclusively relevant to the different businesses
  • assistance in prioritising opportunities
  • assistance in developing a strategy and action plan
  • providing information about prospective buyers/partners
short_description: UK Trade and Investment (UKTI) programme of trading skills for exporters
contact_details: TradeYorkshire 0845 604 8048 Victoria House Victoria Place Leeds LS11 5AE

title: Enterprise Europe - Scotland
long_description:
Enterprise Europe Scotland belongs to Europe's largest technology and business network and connects knowledge, know-how and people across Europe.

Services include information and support on sourcing:

  • market information and specialist advice
  • EU legislation, standards, policy and feedback
  • EU Funding
  • public sector contracts
  • building commercial, technology and research partnerships
  • collaborative research and development
short_description: Information network supporting Scottish business opportunities in Europe
contact_details: Scottish Enterprise info@enterprise-europe-scotland.com 0141 228 2797 Atrium Court 50 Waterloo Street Glasgow G2 6HQ

title: Women on the Move - Ballymena
eligibility: Applicants must be based in the Ballymena area of Northern Ireland.
long_description: The programme provides female entrepreneurs with a number of support services to help them develop their business or idea. This includes access to a range of workshops, seminars and networks.
short_description: Women's business networking in Northern Ireland
contact_details: Ballymena Business Centre 028 2565 8616 62 Fenaghy Road Galgorm Industrial Estate Galgorm Ballymena BT42 1FL

title: Green Apple Environment Award
additional_information: There is no entry fee associated with this award.
evaluation: Judges are appointed from within the environmental sector.
long_description:
The award provides recognition to businesses who promote environmental best practice in their operations.

This award feeds into the European Business Awards for the Environment.

Winners gain the benefit of publicity, the award and attendance at the awards ceremony at the House of Commons.
short_description: Environmental best practice awards for businesses
contact_details: Green Organisation 01604 810 507 The Mill House Mill Lane Earls Barton Northampton NN6 0NR

title: Energy Efficiency Loans
additional_information: In England, this is part of the Solutions for Business Improving Your Resource Efficiency product.
eligibility: SMEs that have been trading for at least 12 months are eligible to apply.
long_description: The Energy Efficiency Loan scheme offers small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) loans to enable them to replace or upgrade equipment with more energy efficient versions.
short_description: Interest free loans for making businesses more energy efficient
contact_details: Carbon Trust customercentre@carbontrust.co.uk 0800 085 2005 Customer Centre PO Box 89 Witney OX29 4WB

title: English Woodland Grant Scheme
additional_information:
The grants are managed and administered on a regional basis. Contact the Forestry Commission for further details.

Projects must improve the woodland environment for public benefit.
long_description:
The Forestry Commission offers a range of grants to enhance or create woodland.

There are six types of grant:

  • Woodland Planning Grant
  • Woodland Assessment Grant
  • Woodland Regeneration Grant
  • Woodland Improvement Grant
  • Woodland Management Grant
  • Woodland Creation Grant
short_description: Grants to improve woodlands
contact_details: Forestry Commission 0117 372 1070 Great Eastern House Tenison Road Cambridge CB1 2DU

title: Woodland Management Grant
additional_information:
The grants are managed and administered on a regional basis. Contact the Forestry Commission for further details.

Projects must improve the woodland environment for public benefit.
eligibility: Owners or leaseholders of woodland in England may apply.
long_description:
The Woodland Management Grant (WMG) aims to encourage low-key sustainable woodland practice. The objectives of the grant are:

  • to contribute to the additional costs of providing public benefits that arise from meeting the UK Forestry Standard for sustainable woodland management
  • to protect, increase and maintain woodland
  • to identify and address threats to woodland, prevent decline and increase the capacity for sustainable management
short_description: Help with costs for improving and maintaining woodland
contact_details: Forestry Commission 0117 372 1070 Great Eastern House Tenison Road Cambridge CB1 2DU

title: Coalfields Enterprise Fund - Northumberland
additional_information: For details of eligible areas, please contact the scheme's organisers.
eligibility:
Businesses based in Northumberland may be eligible. Companies based outside the region may apply if:

  • a proportion of their workforce are Northumberland residents
  • they use companies based in Northumberland as suppliers
long_description:
This scheme offers venture capital to new and existing growth-orientated businesses in the coalfield areas of Northumberland.

Mezzanine funding may also be available for established companies.
short_description: Venture capital for businesses in England's former coalfield areas
contact_details: Enterprise Ventures Limited info@evgroup.uk.com 0870 766 8237 Preston Technology Management Ctr Marsh Lane Preston Lancashire PR1 8UQ

  • a proportion of their workforce are Nottinghamshire residents
  • they use companies based in Nottinghamshire as suppliers
long_description:
This scheme offers venture capital to new and existing growth-orientated businesses in the coalfield areas of Nottinghamshire.

Mezzanine funding may also be available for established companies.

contact_details: Enterprise Ventures Limited info@evgroup.uk.com 0870 766 8237 Preston Technology Management Ctr Marsh Lane Preston Lancashire PR1 8UQ

  • a proportion of their workforce are Durham residents
  • they use companies based in Durham as suppliers

This scheme offers venture capital to new and existing growth-orientated businesses in the coalfield areas of Durham.

Mezzanine funding may also be available for established companies.

contact_details: Enterprise Ventures Limited info@evgroup.uk.com 0870 766 8237 Preston Technology Management Ctr Marsh Lane Preston Lancashire PR1 8UQ

title: Grants for Historic Buildings, Monuments and Designed Landscapes - England
additional_information: Applicants are advised to contact their regional office for further information.
eligibility:
To qualify for a grant under this scheme, projects are expected to involve one of the following:

  • a scheduled monument
  • a building listed at grade I or II
  • a designed landscape that is included in English Heritage's Register of Parks and Gardens at grade I or II
evaluation: Applicants must demonstrate a genuine financial need.
long_description:
Financial support is available for the repair and conservation of historic buildings, monuments and designed landscapes.

Grants are primarily for urgent repairs or other work required within two years to prevent loss or damage to important features.
short_description: Grants for repair and conservation of historic buildings, monuments and landscapes
contact_details: English Heritage customers@english-heritage.org.uk 0870 333 1181 Kemble Drive Swindon SN2 2YP

title: Technical Advisory Unit - Northern Ireland
eligibility: The service is open to all businesses in Northern Ireland.
long_description:
The Technical Advisory Unit (TAU) provides a range of free advice and services to help businesses solve technical, energy and environmental problems. The unit also provides support for implementing best practice in these areas to help businesses achieve sustainable development.

Assistance and advice from TAU will enable you to:

  • meet regulatory responsibilities in environmental issues, product registration and health and safety
  • be aware of intellectual property, patents and trademark needs for products and processes
  • keep up to date with European and British Standards
  • understand innovative product and process development
  • benefit from engineering assistance, including in the areas of CE marking, failure analysis and corrosion investigations
short_description: Free advice to help businesses solve technical, energy and environmental problems
contact_details: Invest Northern Ireland tau@investni.com 028 9069 8819 Bedford Square Bedford Street Belfast BT2 7ES

title: CE Marking - Northern Ireland
eligibility: CE Marking is available to all Invest NI clients.
long_description:
The CE Marking programme consists of a series of seminars, on-site training and one-to-one practical consultancy support. It will increase your knowledge of EU product directives, the relevant health, safety and environmental protection and legal standards, and the CE Marking self-certification process. It will also help your business to:

  • affix CE Marking
  • improve product portfolio and marketability
  • gain easier access to European markets
short_description: Helping manufacturers meet 'European Conformity' for exporting their goods
contact_details: Invest Northern Ireland 028 9069 8825 Bedford Square Bedford Street Belfast BT2 7ES

title: Knowledge Transfer Partnership - Northern Ireland
eligibility: Applicants must be based in Northern Ireland.
long_description:
The scheme helps businesses develop effective linkages with third-level education, and helps improve competitiveness by making use of the knowledge, technology and skill that resides within third-level education. The benefits to the business side of the partnership include:

  • new knowledge and expertise brought into your business
  • increased profits
  • increased skill and knowledge of existing employees
  • long-term strategic relationships with third-level education sector
  • a culture of innovation embedded into your business
short_description: Projects partnering businesses with academic skilled associates
contact_details: Invest Northern Ireland claire.griffin@investni.com 028 9069 8251 Bedford Square Bedford Street Belfast BT2 7ES

title: Export Skills and Knowledge Workshops - Northern Ireland
eligibility: The workshops are open to all export-focused businesses from any sector, involved in manufacturing or trade services.
long_description: This comprehensive programme allows inexperienced exporters to develop and strengthen their exporting skills and enables more experienced exporters to refresh their knowledge and obtain an update on current best practice.
short_description: Exporting skills for businesses based in Northern Ireland
contact_details: Invest Northern Ireland exportworkshops@investni.com 028 9069 8066 Bedford Square Bedford Street Belfast BT2 7ES

title: National Employer Service
long_description:
The National Employer Service (NES) provides expert, impartial advice on workforce development strategies to all national, multi-site employers with more than 5000 employees, accompanied by a range of funding support.

NES helps employers understand, develop and invest in large scale, highly cost-effective embedded training programmes by enabling them to procure, promote and deliver the training they need in the way that works best for their businesses.

Some of the training programmes that NES offer advice on include:

  • apprenticeships
  • jobcentre Plus
  • skills for Life
  • awarding Bodies
short_description: Provides support to help businesses make sense of Government skills strategy
contact_details: Skills Funding Agency info@nationalemployerservice.org.uk 0800 0150 600 Cheylesmore House Quinton Road Coventry CV1 2WT

title: Enhanced Capital Allowance (ECA) Energy Scheme
additional_information: The ETPL lists the products which are eligible for 100 per cent tax relief.
eligibility: In Northern Ireland and Wales all businesses can apply but in Scotland and England only small to medium-sized enterprises may apply.
long_description: This scheme provides businesses with enhanced tax relief for investments in equipment that meets published energy-saving criteria.
short_description: Tax relief for businesses investing in energy-saving equipment
contact_details: Carbon Trust 0800 085 2005 Customer Centre Sitel House Timothys Bridge Road Stratford upon Avon Warwickshire CV37 9HY

  • benchmarking
  • information and advice on effluent waste
  • support implementing water efficient technologies
short_description: Supporting businesses in reducing water bills
contact_details: WRAP 0808 100 2040 01295 819 900 The Old Academy 21 Horsefair Banbury AX16 0AH

  • the management of existing woodlands
  • woodland improvement activities
  • the improvement of forestry business performance and competitiveness
short_description: Grants for developing woodlands and forestry
contact_details: Forestry Commission Scotland 0131 334 0303 Silvan House 231 Corstorphine Road Edinburgh EH12 7AT

contact_details: Forestry Commission Scotland 0131 334 0303 Silvan House 231 Corstorphine Road Edinburgh EH12 7AT

eligibility: Applicants must be based in the West Midlands.

  • materials
  • energy

The scheme provides support to businesses to help them take a fresh look at their resourcing. It deals with the resourcing of:

  • materials
  • energy
  • water
  • logistics
  • shared assets
short_description: Consultancy for business resourcing

title: European Fisheries Fund (EFF)
eligibility:
Applications will be assessed on a range of criteria including:

  • communities with a low population density and a proven tradition of fishing
  • fisheries in decline - supported by data on catch, vessels and employment
  • measurable economic benefits
  • reducing waste and discards
  • reducing the impact of fishing on the environment and habitats
  • potential for creating opportunities for the entire community
  • evidence of a balanced and inclusive group
  • a high level of community involvement with the fishing sector
long_description: The European Fisheries Fund (EEF) has been set up to promote the sustainable development of fisheries in smaller communities dependent on fishing for employment. Each group must demonstrate, via a detailed business plan, a clear understanding of the issues and opportunities facing their industry and how they will promote sustainable fishing in their area.
short_description: Grants for sustainable development in commercial fishing and aquaculture
contact_details: Marine Management Organisation eff.projects@marinemanagement.org.uk 0191 376 2505 Business Relations Team PO Box 1275 Newcastle upon Tyne NE99 5BN

title: Business Expansion Support - Orkney
additional_information: Businesses in receipt of support from other public sector agencies may be ineligible for support.
eligibility:
Priority is given to businesses which will be operating in the following sectors:

  • manufacturing products primarily for export
  • tourism accommodation and facilities excluding Mainland and linked South Isles self catering accommodation
  • service sector where the service is primarily for export or where the service is unique to Orkney

Applicants must submit a business plan.

Projects with a minimum capital expenditure of £5,000 may be eligible.
long_description:
The Council provides a grant for business expansions in Orkney. The grant may cover projects such as:

  • constructing new buildings
  • improving existing buildings
  • purchasing equipment or machinery
short_description: Advice and grants for Orkney businesses
contact_details: Business Gateway Orkney Business.gateway@orkney.gov.uk 01856 886 666 14 Queen Street Kirkwall Orkney KW15 1JE

eligibility: Decision taken on a case by case basis.
long_description:
The Council wants to encourage the establishment and expansion of companies in the renewables sector.

The Council is driving forward initiatives which:

  • secure employment in manufacturing, research, development and the supply chain
  • support income-generation from community projects
  • support ongoing fossil generation replacement and C02 reductions
short_description: Supporting and sustaining renewable energy industries
contact_details: Business Gateway Orkney Business.gateway@orkney.gov.uk 01856 886 666 14 Queen Street Kirkwall Orkney KW15 1JE

eligibility: Applicants must be based in the Orkney Islands.

short_description: Promoting businesses in Orkney
contact_details: Business Gateway Orkney Business.gateway@orkney.gov.uk 01856 886 666 14 Queen Street Kirkwall Orkney KW15 1JE

title: Marine Skills Centre - Falmouth

title: Small Business Grant - Sunderland
eligibility:

In order to qualify, projects must meet certain criteria:

  • the business must be located in Sunderland or looking to relocate to Sunderland
  • the business must demonstrate viability
  • all grants are discretionary and applications must be made before committing to the project
  • in most cases applicants must be creating new jobs
  • the final award will depend on the number of new jobs created

Exclusions include:

  • retail businesses
  • home-based businesses
  • manufacturing or services with direct sales to the public
  • construction or building contractors
long_description:
This grant is designed to help start-up businesses and those which have been trading for less than three years.

The business must be occupying commercial premises but is not required to have a three-year lease.

title: Enterprise Finance Guarantee
additional_information: Enterprise Finance Guarantee has replaced the Small Firms Loan Guarantee scheme.
eligibility:
EFG can be made available (at the lender's discretion):

  • to small and medium-sized businesses in the UK with an annual turnover of up to £25 million
  • to businesses seeking loan facilities of between £1,000 and £1 million
  • for terms of between three months and ten years
  • for an eligible loan purpose

Loans for most businesses purposes to businesses in most sectors are eligible. A list of the main sector restrictions is on the BIS website.
evaluation:
Businesses will need to provide all the information normally required by a lender in connection with a loan application, which will generally involve completing their application form and providing supporting information, typically including your:

  • current business plan, including details of the purpose for which the loan is required and details of other investment in and financial commitments of the business
  • financial projections
  • historic trading figures
  • statutory and management accounts
  • information on any other publicly funded support received by your business within the past three years
long_description:
The Enterprise Finance Guarantee (EFG) is a targeted measure intended to facilitate additional commercial lending to viable SMEs unable to obtain a normal commercial loan due to having no or insufficient security.

EFG facilitates lending that would not otherwise be available by providing lenders with a partial guarantee.

Decisions on the use of EFG, eligibility, and lending terms in individual cases rest with the lender. There is no automatic entitlement to receive a guaranteed loan and nor is there any pre-qualification process for it.

Any loan application will first be assessed via the lender's own commercial criteria before any consideration of the EFG eligibility criteria.

Businesses should approach a number of lenders to discuss their borrowing needs. A list of accredited EFG lenders is on the BIS website.

The following loan facilities may be used under EFG (repayable over terms between three months and ten years, except where indicated):

  • new term loans (unsecured or partially secure)
  • refinancing of existing term loans
  • conversion of an existing overdraft into a term loan
  • invoice finance guarantee (available for terms up to three years)
  • overdraft guarantee (available for terms up to two years)

The precise nature and terms of any facility made available by individual lenders will vary in accordance with that lender's standard commercial lending criteria.

A premium (equivalent to two per cent per annum) is payable to the Department for Business, Innovation and Skills (BIS) in addition to regular capital and interest payments to your lender, and any arrangement fee which they may charge. It is not an insurance premium.

Lenders are allowed to require personal guarantee and/or security where available (except the borrower's principal private residence) in line with their standard normal commercial lending practices.

EFG is intended to support lending to viable businesses that can ultimately repay the loan in full. The government guarantee is a guarantee to the lender. Neither the guarantee nor the premium provides insurance for the borrower in the event of default. The borrower remains fully liable in the event of default.
organiser: Department for Business, Innovation and Skills
short_description: Guarantees to help small businesses access loans
will_continue_on: Department for Business, Innovation and Skills website
contact_details: Department for Business, Innovation and Skills 020 7215 5000 1 Victoria Street London England SW1H 0ET

long_description: Funding available to encourage business start up and enable business and community development in the Outer Hebrides.
short_description: Interest-free loans to help start-ups
contact_details: Business Gateway businessgateway@cne-siar.gov.uk 0185 182 2775 James Square 9 James Street Stornoway Isle of Lewis HS1 2QN

title: Outer Hebrides Fisheries Support Scheme
eligibility:
Applicants must be resident and maintain a business in the Outer Hebrides throughout the period of the loan.

Eligible businesses must have fewer than 50 employees and must operate on a full-time basis.

Only sole traders, partnerships, limited companies and co-operatives are eligible for assistance.

Priority given to:

  • vessels over 12 metres in length
  • vessels less than 10 years old with multi-purpose fishing capability
  • first time skipper/owners
long_description: This support scheme makes funding available for the purchase of fishing vessels.
short_description: Loans to help fishermen under 40 buy a boat
contact_details: Business Gateway businessgateway@cne-siar.gov.uk 0185 182 2775 James Square 9 James Street Stornoway Isle of Lewis HS1 2QN

title: Inter-Island Business Development Scheme
additional_information: This scheme ends in August 2011.
eligibility:
Private sector businesses operating in the Outer Hebrides that trade or propose to trade across the sounds of Harris or Barra.

Commercial ferry rates must apply.
long_description: The main aim of the scheme is to support economic and business development by stimulating and increasing business between the three main island groupings in the Outer Hebrides.
short_description: Scheme to help new and existing businesses in the Outer Hebrides
contact_details: Business Gateway businessgateway@cne-siar.gov.uk 0185 182 2775 James Square 9 James Street Stornoway Isle of Lewis HS1 2QN

title: Business Start-Up Grant - Helensburgh and Lomond District
eligibility:
Applicants must:

  • start a genuine new, full-time business
  • base their business within Helensburgh and Lomond
  • operate and control the business themselves
  • provide proof of trading e.g. evidence of a business bank account
  • provide a business plan

Businesses which have been trading for more than 3 months will not be eligible to apply for this grant.

Successful applicants of the grant must submit their claims within 12 weeks of their applications being approved.
long_description:
A grant of £500 is available to assist individuals over 18 years of age with business start-up costs.

The grant covers areas such as marketing and the purchase of capital equipment.
short_description: Grants for start-ups in Argyll and Bute
contact_details: Argyll and Bute Council business.grants@argyll-bute.gov.uk 01546 605 459 The Enterprise Centre Kilmory Dumbarton Argyll PA31 8SH

title: Community Land Resources Development Programme (CLRDP) 2008 - 2013
eligibility:
The minimum amount of grant awarded will be £10,000 in order to comply with 'Capital Grants to Third Parties' regulations.

Eligible applicants will be properly constituted community organisations or non-profit making user groups.
long_description: The objective of the scheme is to provide support to the land-based sector to assist the stabilisation of a key local industry. It will seek to assist community-owned estates and other constituted community groups such as grazings committees achieve long-term sustainability by investing in specific projects on these estates. It is anticipated that investments will be in plant, machinery, supply-chain support, estate facilities and in community-generated capital projects which aid diversification through communal township activity.
short_description: Grants for non-profit making agricultural projects in Scotland
contact_details: Comhairle nan Eilean Siar enquiries@cne-siar.gov.uk 01870 604 990 Balivanich Council Offices Balivanich Isle of Benbecula HS7 5LA

title: Community Marine Access Scheme
eligibility:
Eligible projects will be publicly accessible marine infrastructure for small craft including slips, jetties, pontoons or other provision for small craft.

Eligible applicants for CoMAS funding will be properly constituted community organisations or non-profit making user groups.
long_description: The aim of the scheme is to assist the provision and improvement of community owned and managed marine access facilities in the Outer Hebrides, principally for the benefit of leisure, recreation and community users.
short_description: Support for community marine access facilities in the Outer Hebrides
contact_details: Comhairle nan Eilean Siar p.middleton@cne-siar.gov.uk 0845 600 7090 Sandwick Road Stornoway Isle of Lewis HS1 2BW

title: Creative Hebrides Fund
eligibility:
Eligible applicants for funding will be properly constituted community organisations or non-profit making user groups.

Can only support items of capital expenditure. It shall not be used to support any kind of revenue cost.
long_description: This fund will support initiatives to enhance economic impact and growth within the creative industries sector.
short_description: Fund for community-based creative projects in the Outer Hebrides
contact_details: Comhairle nan Eilean Siar amurray@cne-siar.gov.uk 01851 709 277 Sandwick Road Stornoway Isle of Lewis HS1 2BW

title: Scotland Rural Development Programme 2007 - 2013
eligibility:
The Crofting Counties Agricultural Grant Scheme and the Less Favoured Area Support Scheme are only available to farmers and crofters.

Only land managers are eligible to apply under RDC Land Managers Options.

All other schemes are open to land managers, businesses, individuals and constituted groups operating in rural Scotland.

Additional conditions on eligibility may apply for each scheme and initiative so it is important that potential applicants consult the relevant scheme guidance.
long_description: The Scotland Rural Development Programme (SRDP) 2007-2013 is the Scottish Government's umbrella programme providing grant funding for Scotland's rural areas. The main emphasis of the SRDP is on improving business viability, enhancing biodiversity and the landscape, improving water quality, tackling climate change and supporting thriving rural communities.
short_description: Grants for individuals and organisations in rural Scotland
contact_details: SNH Office 01851 770 5258 32-34 Francis Street Stornoway Isle of Lewis HS1 2ND

title: PSYBT - Outer Hebrides
eligibility: Aimed at the 18-30 age-group, with particular concern for the disadvantaged.
long_description: Pre-start training, along with business-planning and marketing advice and a two-year Business Aftercare programme.
short_description: Scheme to help younger entrepreneurs in the Outer Hebrides

short_description: Free ICT advice and support service for businesses in Northern Ireland
contact_details: Log on-NI logon-ni@commendium.com 028 8283 9012 Lancer Buildings Gortrush Industrial Estate Great Northern Road Omagh BT78 5EJ

title: West Lothian Loan Fund
eligibility: Business must be based in the West Lothian area.
long_description: Provides loans for incorporated businesses.
short_description: Loans for small to medium-sized businesses in West Lothian
contact_details: West Lothian Council enterprise@westlothian.gov.uk 01506 777 400 The Enterprise Centre Almondvale Boulevard Livingston West Lothian EH54 6QP

title: Local Investment Fund (LIF) - South West Wales
additional_information: Grants will not be awarded retrospectively, so you are reminded not to undertake any expenditure on the project until a formal decision has been reached on the bid and written confirmation of this has been received.
eligibility:
The fund is aimed primarily at businesses in, or servicing, the manufacturing sector, though applications will be considered on a case by case basis. Funding may be available for retail development and direct consumer services in discretionary cases where the applicant can demonstrate a niche market and no issue of displacement.

Qualifying capital expenditure includes:

  • purchase of new or second-hand fixed equipment (machinery, specialist equipment etc)
  • IT and telecom hardware if linked directly to the delivery of the project
  • premises improvement (to modify and improve premises to accommodate increased capacity, improve efficiency, incorporate new processes)
  • one-off, non-recurring marketing costs such as exhibition or display materials and promotional material
  • website development, e-commerce development and purchases of specialist (non-standard) software

Each case will be assessed on its potential value to the local economy. Factors that are likely to add strength to applications include potential job creation, increase in turnover as a result of the grant, positive environmental improvements and the adoption or improvement of equal opportunity strategies and systems.

Businesses located in Carmarthenshire, Ceredigion, Swansea and Pembrokeshire, and Neath Port Talbot can apply and take advantage of the fund.
evaluation:
Prospective applicants are initially requested to complete an expression of interest form. All applicants should be in receipt of business advice, and evidence of this should be submitted with the application.

The form will provide your local authority with brief details about your business, together with an overview of your proposed project, grant requirements and previous public sector financial support received over the past three years. This information will enable the LIF project officer to make a decision on the eligibility of the business and project. If deemed successful you will be invited to submit a full application.
long_description: The South West Wales Business Finance Scheme is a package of flexible financial support to assist new and existing businesses by offering capital grants of 40 per cent of eligible project costs.
short_description: Grants for new and existing businesses in South West Wales
contact_details: Welsh Government 03000 6 03000 0126 724 2390 Rural Business Centre Nantyci Camarthen SA33 5DR

title: Local Investment Fund (LIF) - North West Wales
additional_information: Grants will not be awarded retrospectively, so you are reminded not to undertake any expenditure on the project until a formal decision has been reached on the bid and written confirmation of this has been received.
eligibility:
The fund is designed to develop the local economy by stimulating business activity. To be considered, your project must meet one or more of these objectives:

  • creating jobs
  • sustaining jobs
  • increasing turnover
  • aiding business growth
  • increasing business growth
  • making efficiency gains
  • increasing sustainability
  • stimulating further investment or growth
  • introducing new products, services or markets
  • supporting a key sector (clean or renewable energy, environmental management, telecommunications, ICT, financial or professional products or services, creative industries, automotive, aerospace, construction, food, defence, retail, leisure and tourism)
  • creating or developing a social enterprise
evaluation:
Prospective applicants are initially requested to complete an expression of interest form. All applicants should be in receipt of business advice, and evidence of this should be submitted with the application.

The form will provide your local authority with brief details about your business, together with an overview of your proposed project, grant requirements and previous public sector financial support received over the past three years. This information will enable the LIF project officer to make a decision on the eligibility of the business and project. If deemed successful you will be invited to submit a full application.
long_description: The local Investment Fund (LIF) is a package of flexible financial support to assist new and existing businesses by offering capital grants of 40 per cent of eligible projects.
short_description: Grants for new ad existing businesses in North West Wales
contact_details: Welsh Government 03000 6 03 000 0128 667 9231 Intec Innovation and Technology Centre Parc Menai Bangor LL57 4FG

title: Social Enterprise Support
additional_information: The Wales Co-operative Centre is a national agency supporting community regeneration, economic development and social justice through co-operative solutions. The Centre was set up in 1982 by the Wales TUC to help redundant workers from heavy industry. It has evolved into an organisation helping businesses and local communities across Wales.
eligibility: Wales Co-operative Centre are publicly funded to support social enterprises and co-operatives across Wales.
long_description:
The Wales Co-operative Centre supports the development and growth of social entrepreneurship, social enterprises and co-operatives in convergence areas of Wales.

Our team of specialist advisors work with groups who wish to set up a new social enterprise or co-operative. We also work with existing social enterprises and co-operatives who wish to grow and develop.

Each group works with a specialist advisor, who devises an action plan for them. This plan is then delivered by a range of consultants with expertise in areas such as business planning, legal structures, personnel, finance and marketing.

Support is also delivered through training, mentoring, masterclasses and networking.

This support is funded through the European Union's convergence programmes with match funding from the Welsh Assembly Government.
short_description: Business support for co-operatives and social enterprises in Wales
contact_details: Wales Co-operative Centre walescoop@walescoop.com 0300 111 5050 Llandaff Court Fairwater Road Cardiff CF5 2XP

title: ProAct - Skills Growth Wales
eligibility: Growing businesses that can show how the funding will help them grow, or companies that have identified a significant growth opportunity and need training to take advantage of it. This funding is for businesses who would not otherwise have been able to fund this training, or undertake it as soon as they would desire. Most companies in this situation will be linked to Welsh Government Relationship Managers who can advise on the process.
long_description: Funding is available to private or third sector businesses that are growing or have identified a clear growth opportunity and have the ability to take advantage of it.
short_description: Funding to upskill staff during short time working
contact_details: Welsh Government info@skillspeoplesuccess.com 0845 606 6160 Ladywell House Newtown Powys SY16 1JB

title: Wales Innovation Award
additional_information:
Entrants will have the opportunity to attend half-day workshops which describe the requirements of the award. These will provide examples of the kind of data the judges expect to see.

The award costs £50.00 + VAT to enter.

This award will close for applications on 19 September 2011. Please see website for further details.
eligibility: These awards are open to all teams or organisations employed directly, or indirectly, for the benefit of the public, private and third sectors in Wales.
evaluation:
The award process will evaluate the methodology used by entrants to create genuinely innovative products, services and people processes.

The award will test the efficacy of formalised processes which organisations use to manage innovation. For processes which are less formal but none the less successful in their innovation, the award will expose areas where they can improve innovative thinking. For those which have neither but do have an innovative culture, the award will offer examples of how they might improve the outcome of their innovative approach.

The award assessment model is designed to evaluate 3 distinct areas:

  • product
  • service
  • people

The judging will be carried out by a team of up to 12 people who are related to and known as innovative in their field of work. This will include individuals from the private, public and third sectors and individuals from academia.
long_description:
The intention behind the award is to recognise innovation within the private, public and third sectors across Wales.

In particular the award is seeking to demonstrate as broadly as possible the range of innovative thinking that takes place in all sectors as well as technology.
short_description: Innovation award for the Welsh public, private and voluntary sectors
contact_details: Wales Quality Centre 01656 652 063 Waterton Centre Waterton Industrial Estate Bridgend CF31 3WT

title: Wales Quality Award
additional_information:
The award costs £50.00 + VAT to enter.

This award will close for applications on 15 August 2011. Please see website for further details.
eligibility: Entrants of the Wales Quality Award will be Welsh organisations, subsidiaries or divisions from all areas across all sectors.
evaluation: Award entrants are required to prepare a submission which will be assessed and scored by a team of trained assessors. A site visit is carried out to obtain further information and observe best practices in action. Having agreed a final score for the submission, the assessment team compile a feedback report detailing their findings.
long_description:
The Wales Quality Award is based on the use of the EFQM excellence model.

The model is a business diagnostic tool which organisations can use to self assess, plan, change, drive business improvement and ultimately gain competitive advantage. The model is not prescriptive but gives clear direction and opens new areas of thinking for any organisation regardless of size or industry sector.
short_description: Business improvement tool
contact_details: Wales Quality Centre info@walesqualitycentre.org.uk 01656 652 063 Waterton Centre Waterton Industrial Estate Bridgend CF31 3WT

title: Llwyddo yng Ngwynedd - Mentro
eligibility:
The project aims to encourage enterprise within specific target groups in Gwynedd:

  • farming families
  • community groups
  • children up to ten years old
  • young people (20 - 30 years old)
  • under employed (such as people who are not in education, employment or training; people who are receiving incapacity benefits, people who are registered as disabled and people in early retirement)

You can apply:

  • if you belong to one of the target groups
  • if your start-up costs are less than £10,000
  • if the venture you intend to establish is new
  • if you want to set up your venture in Gwynedd
  • if this bursary would be essential in order to start the venture
  • if you live in the Llwyddo yng Ngwynedd area, which includes all of Gwynedd except for the Glyder, Menai, Garth, Hirael, Deiniol, Marchog , Hendre and Dewi wards, which represents the city of Bangor
long_description:
The support available includes:

The Llwyddo yng Ngwynedd Mentro project provides an opportunity for groups and individuals to test trade a new venture for a limited period of time or on a more permanent basis. The venture could be on a part or full time basis.

  • a bursary of up to £3,000 to allow a group or individual to start or trial their venture idea
  • sessions to help stimulate new venture ideas
short_description: Support for people in Gwynedd wanting to start a business
contact_details: Menter a Busnes bangor@menterabusnes.co.uk 01248 672 633 Intec Parc Menai Bangor LL57 4FG

title: Business Support and Relief Package
eligibility:
The eligibility criteria for the scheme are:

  • the business must be a rate payer based in Carmarthenshire
  • the business must employ fewer than 250 people
  • the business must have a turnover not exceeding €50 million or a balance sheet not exceeding €43 million
  • the funding support is not for capital expenditure it must be demonstrated that it will only be used for short-term cashflow requirements
  • only one application per business
  • the business must have been established for more than two years
  • the application must be completed and verified by the applicant's accountant
  • all requested information must be made available prior to any assessment being made - incomplete applications cannot be assessed and will be returned
evaluation:
To ease the assessment process, the council would encourage each applicant to provide as much relevant detail as possible and to ensure that everything requested in the checklist is provided.

An accountant's statement and verification is required to determine the optimum loan amount and support package and repayment term for the applicant - any application cannot be assessed until this is in place.
long_description:
Short-term flexible loans can be offered to applicants who demonstrate a short-term cashflow requirement.

Monthly interest on the loan principal will be paid by direct debit with the principal being repaid to the council within an agreed period of time between the council and the applicant and at a flexible repayment schedule to suit the applicant.
short_description: Short-term loans for businesses in Carmarthenshire
contact_details: Carmarthenshire County Council 01267 242 331 Business Resource Centre Parc Amanwy New Road Ammanford SA19 3EP

title: Participation Discretionary Fund
eligibility: The fund is only available to clients participating in the Welsh Government start-up programme (including the graduate support programme), and should be accessed by clients directly from their start-up provider.
long_description:
Through start-up providers, the Welsh Government provides the Inclusion Challenge Fund.

This fund offers additional support to people from under-represented groups to help overcome any barriers they may face while accessing and participating in the start-up business programme.

The main under-represented groups in Wales (in terms of participation in business) are:

  • women
  • lone parents
  • under 30s
  • over 50s
  • Welsh speakers
  • disabled people
  • ethnic minorities
short_description: Additional support to help people from under-represented groups set up a business
contact_details: Welsh Government 0300 060 3000 Ty Castell 3 Ynys Bridge Court Gwaelod-y-Garth Cardiff CF15 9SS

title: Wales SME Recycling Support
long_description: The Welsh Assembly Government and WRAP Cymru have identified the need to offer incentives to create both new and expanded collection networks and SME-focussed infrastructure, aiming to facilitate an increase in SME recycling rates and help establish a sustainable collection and bring site network.
short_description: Grant scheme to support recycling schemes by small and medium-sized firms in Wales
contact_details: WRAP Cymru 029 2044 8090 Suite 16 Bay Chambers Cardiff CF10 5BB

title: Grant for Research and Development - Northern Ireland
eligibility:
All projects must be viable, show a need for Invest NI support, and generate a positive return to the economy.

Grant for R&D is available to both individuals and new or existing businesses that want to carry out an R&D project either on their own or by collaborating with other businesses, universities or research bodies.
long_description: To help businesses become more innovative and competitive by offering a range of financial and advisory research and development support through a single gateway.
short_description: Advice and support to help businesses become more innovative
contact_details: Invest Northern Ireland 028 9069 8607 Bedford Square Bedford Street Belfast BT2 7ES

Excluded sectors:

  • agriculture
  • primary food processing
  • steel sectors
  • residential

  • retail

Although excluded sectors are highlighted there may be circumstances when these sectors are eligible e.g. Applicants should contact the partnership to determine this.
long_description: This scheme provides financial assistance for the construction of speculative buildings for industrial / office use with the primary aim of creating capacity for employment in selected areas of South West Wales.
short_description: Finance for  firms developing industrial buildings in high unemployment areas
contact_details: Carmarthenshire County Council 01269 590 241 Physical Regeneration Unit Economic Development Division Business Resource Centre Parc Amanwy Ammanford SA18 3EP

title: Internet Marketing Check
eligibility:
Companies must be operating from business premises within Glasgow City Council's boundary.

Business must generate more than 50 per cent of turnover from outwith Glasgow.

Business must generate more than 50 per cent of their turnover from manufacturing.

Businesses must employ less than 250 people worldwide.
long_description:
The marketing review will review the company's overall performance to date and ask the following questions:

  • does the company have a traditional (off-line) marketing strategy in place?
  • does the marketing plan include internet marketing?
  • how does the company currently market its products?
  • where does most of the business come from, ie on or off-line?
  • what role does the current website play?
  • what is the point of the website?
  • what mechanism is in place to evaluate traditional marketing performance?
  • is the performance of the website and internet marketing evaluated?
short_description: Scheme to help firms review and improve their online marketing
contact_details: Glasgow City Council 0141 287 7263 Development and Regeneration 229 George Street Glasgow G1 1QU

title: Early Response (ER)
eligibility:
To be eligible businesses must fall into one or more of the following categories:

  • existing SME businesses trading in Glasgow
  • employing five or more people
  • trading from business premises or Council premises
  • in receipt of a loan from the Council or
  • considering making application for financial support from the Council
long_description: Glasgow City Council is offering the services of an expert appraisal to Glasgow companies who have expressed concern about trading through the current economic downturn. An Early Respons team of experts will carry out independent reviews of distressed companies who have a significant presence in Glasgow and are experiencing trading problems due to the recession.
short_description: Reviews and advice for firms hit by the economic downturn
contact_details: Glasgow City Council 0141 287 7263 Development and Regeneration 229 George Street Glasgow G1 1QU

title: Zero Waste Scotland Small Business Support Programme
eligibility: Businesses with 50 or less employees.
long_description:
This programme provides flexible, client-led, practical support to small businesses, aimed at the implementation of cost-saving environmental improvements. On-site support will primarily focus on opportunities to reduce waste production, packaging, raw material and water use. Other areas covered as part of the on-site review include energy efficiency and waste management, and for businesses in the tourism sector, assistance towards Green Tourism Business Scheme accreditation.

A dedicated Business Environmental Adviser can provide businesses with the following:

  • a free site review - covering waste, water and energy
  • production of a detailed site report and Action Plan
  • support with implementation of the Action Plan
  • advice on relevant site-specific legislation
  • information on sources of financial and other support
short_description: Fund to help small businesses work together to recycle
contact_details: Green Business Partnership 0131 561 6262 42/3 Hardengreen Business Park Dalhousie Road Dalkeith EH22 3NU

long_description: A development grant for existing businesses in East Lothian.
short_description: Development grants for businesses in East Lothian

eligibility: Businesses based in both North and South Lanarkshire may apply.
long_description: Lanarkshire Business Training Support provides grant funding towards the training of company personnel. Grant support is available to meet the cost of engaging an external training provider. Funding is available for a wide range of training (except that required by legislation), customised to individual company needs to support company development.

additional_information: Loans may be used for working capital, purchase of plant, equipment and business property.
eligibility: Businesses based in both North and South Lanarkshire may apply.
