long_description:
The Business Angel Co-investment Loan Facility, is a Solutions for Business Finance for Business product.

£1.25 million has been set aside from the Regional Growth Loan scheme for co-investment in high growth small and medium-sized enterprises in the East of England, aiming to encourage business angel investment in businesses that:

  • are based within the East of England region
  • have strong growth potential
  • have identified business angels that are willing to invest
short_description: Assists early stage small and medium sized enterprises across the East of England
contact_details: Finance East Loan Management enquiries@financeeast.com 0147 372 2910 Unit 1 Basepoint Business Centre 70-72 The Havens Ransomes Ipswich Suffolk IP3 9BF

title: East of England Regional Growth Loan Scheme
additional_information: Please see the website for further information.
eligibility:
Loans will be available to new and existing limited companies that meet the following criteria:

  • a clear business strategy that credibly delivers significant growth
  • a proposition that addresses product markets which are likely to grow strongly in the medium term
  • a business plan demonstrating such things as a viable product or service, a ready market and competitive advantage
long_description:
The Regional Growth Loan Scheme, is a Solutions for Business Finance for Business product. The scheme is available to existing incorporated business that:

  • are based within the East of England region
  • have forecast a minimum turnover of £500,000
  • have strong growth potential
  • have a long term investment need to deliver that growth potential

The fund cannot be used to:

  • refinance existing financial arrangements
  • raise working capital
  • finance a turnaround situation
  • fund not-for-profit businesses, social enterprises or unincorporated businesses
short_description: Assists small and medium sized enterprises across the East of England
contact_details: Finance East Loan Management enquiries@financeeast.com 0147 372 2910 Unit 1 Basepoint Business Centre 70-72 The Havens Ransomes Ipswich Suffolk IP3 9BF

title: Business Gateway New Business Start-up Grant - Orkney
eligibility:
Applicants for start-up funding must be developing a new, full-time start-up business.

The business must not have already started up prior to application.

The business owner must reside in Orkney and own and operate the business themselves.

Applicants must submit a business plan with two years cash flow projections.

Applicants in receipt of other grant funding may not be eligible for this funding.
long_description:
Business Gateway provides a grant for new businesses in Orkney. The grant may cover any start up costs such as:

  • equipment
  • training
  • marketing
short_description: Grants for new businesses in Orkney
contact_details: Business Gateway business.gateway@orkney.gov.uk 0185 6886 666 14 Queen Street Kirkwall Orkney KW15 1JE

title: Guardian Angels - One to One Mentoring
long_description:
This scheme aims to assist local businesses in developing and achieving greater success by providing them with access to experienced, knowledgeable and skilled business professionals.

It offers small business owners and managers the chance to work with an experienced business leader, allowing them to realise their leadership and business potential.
short_description: Provides local businesses with access to experienced, knowledgeable and skilled business mentors
contact_details: Community and Business Partners guardians@cbpartners.org 0125 450 5050 Suite 1 Blackburn Enterprise Centre Furthergate Blackburn Lancashire BB1 3HQ

title: Digital Tourism Business Framework Programme - Creating Digital Tourism Communities
additional_information: Please see the website for further information.
long_description:
The Digital Tourism Business Framework Project will assist tourism businesses and supporting organisations to adopt new technologies. This will enable them to meet and exceed visitor expectations and become more competitive in the market place as a result. The support available will include:

  • ICT diagnostics and assessments
  • workshops, training and seminars to assist with technological development
  • development of digital communities and innovative pilots
  • sharing of knowledge and content
short_description: Support for tourism businesses adopt new technologies
contact_details: Welsh Government digitaltourismprojects@wales.gsi.gov.uk 0292 092 5459 Brunel House 2 Fitzalan Road Cardiff CF24 0UY

title: Digital Tourism Business Framework Programme - Innovative Pilots
additional_information: Please see the website for further information.
long_description:
The Digital Tourism Business Framework Programme (DTBF) seeks to assist tourism businesses and supporting organisations in adopting new technologies that enable them to meet visitor expectations and become more competitive in the market place.

The DTBF programme will support the tourism industry in Wales to become better equipped, through the emerging use of collaborative ICT, to generate, share and distribute tourism content and provide potential visitors with information they require to make decisions and visit Wales. The result being major performance gains and enhanced competitiveness through innovative communities, projects, ICT awareness and maturity.

Based on increased knowledge, successful innovative tourism product ideas will be supported as pilots. Due to the rapid developments in technology, on-line and mobile services, the types of innovative pilots supported are very loosely defined but will be expected to demonstrate:

  • scientific or technological excellence
  • effective implementation, management and achievement of outcomes
  • long term sustainable impact or exploitation opportunities beyond the DTBF funding period
short_description: Support for tourism businesses adopt new technologies
contact_details: Welsh Government digitaltourismprojects@wales.gsi.gov.uk 0292 092 5459 Brunel House 2 Fitzalan Road Cardiff CF24 0UY

title: Aberdeen City and Shire First Employee Grant Scheme
additional_information: Payment of the grant will be made in two stages, with 50 per cent being paid when the employee is in place, and the balance paid in six months following verification of continued employment.
eligibility:
Businesses must meet the following criteria before an application for assistance will be considered:

  • this must be the first employee of the business
  • the employee must work a minimum of 30 hours per week
  • the employee must not be a partner or investor of the business
  • systems must be in place to deduct National Insurance and PAYE
  • the business must be able to afford to take on an employee
  • the awarding of a grant must not be detrimental to other local businesses
long_description: This scheme provides advice and grant support for businesses taking on their first employee.
short_description: Advice and grant support for businesses taking on their first employee
contact_details: Aberdeenshire Council 0122 4664 771 Woodhill House Westburn Road Aberdeen AB16 5GB

title: Smart - Proof of Market Grant
eligibility: Pre start-ups, start-ups, and small and medium-sized businesses from all sectors across the UK may apply.
evaluation: Applications are accepted on a rolling basis for assessment by independent experts.
long_description:
This scheme is offering funding to small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) to engage in research and development projects in the strategically important areas of science, engineering and technology, from which successful new products, processes and services could emerge.

The Grant for Research and Development (Grant for R&D) scheme will support research and development projects which offer potentially significant rewards and could stimulate UK economic growth.

The Proof of Market grant enables businesses to assess the commercial viability of a project, through:

  • market research
  • market testing and competitor analysis
  • intellectual property position
  • initial planning to take the project to commercialisation, including assessing costs, timescales and funding requirements
short_description: Support for research and development projects that could stimulate UK economic growth
contact_details: Technology Strategy Board enquiries@tsb.gov.uk 0300 321 4357 North Star House North Star Avenue Swindon SN2 1UE

title: Smart  - Proof of Concept Grant
eligibility: Pre start-ups, start-ups, and small and medium-sized businesses from all sectors across the UK may apply.
evaluation: Applications are accepted on a rolling basis for assessment by independent experts.
long_description:
This scheme is offering funding to small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) to engage in research and development projects in the strategically important areas of science, engineering and technology, from which successful new products, processes and services could emerge.

The Grant for Research and Development (Grant for R&D) scheme will support research and development projects which offer potentially significant rewards and could stimulate UK economic growth.

The Proof of Concept grant may be used to explore the technical feasibility and commercial potential of a new technology, product or process, including:

  • initial feasibility studies
  • basic prototyping
  • specialist testing and/or demonstration to provide basic proof of technical feasibility
  • intellectual property protection
  • investigation of production and assembly options

It also includes pre-clinical research studies for healthcare technologies and medicines, including target identification and validation.
short_description: Support for research and development projects that could stimulate UK economic growth
contact_details: Technology Strategy Board enquiries@tsb.gov.uk 0179 344 2700 North Star House North Star Avenue Swindon SN2 1UE

title: Smart - Development of Prototype
eligibility: Pre start-ups, start-ups, and small and medium-sized businesses from all sectors across the UK may apply.
long_description:
This scheme is offering funding to small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) to engage in research and development projects in the strategically important areas of science, engineering and technology, from which successful new products, processes and services could emerge.

The Grant for Research and Development (Grant for R&D) scheme will support research and development projects which offer potentially significant rewards and could stimulate UK economic growth.

The Development of Prototype grant can be used by businesses to develop a technologically innovative product, service or industrial process, and can include projects such as:

  • small demonstrators
  • intellectual property protection
  • trials and testing, including clinical
  • market testing
short_description: Support for research and development projects that could stimulate UK economic growth
contact_details: Technology Strategy Board enquiries@tsb.gov.uk 0179 344 2700 North Star House North Star Avenue Swindon SN2 1UE

title: Supporting Sustainable Living Grant Scheme
eligibility: It is open to organisations from all sectors that are legally constituted or incorporated with their own bank account. Individuals cannot apply. Applicants must be based in Wales and all project activities must take place in Wales.
evaluation: Grants can fund project design, delivery and evaluation. They cannot be used for internal staff time but can pay for time of contractors, trainers, external consultants etc.
long_description:
The aim of the Supporting Sustainable Living Grant Scheme is bring about long-term changes in lifestyle that will help reduce Wales' greenhouse gas emissions and make communities more resilient to the impacts of climate change.

Applications must:

  • be based on evidence, or a recognised model or theory, that suggests that the proposed activities will be successful in changing behaviour
  • deliver, or have the clear potential to deliver, either reductions in greenhouse gas emissions or resilience to changes in climate
  • be able to demonstrate how project outputs (interventions) and outcomes (behaviour changes and resulting impact on scheme aims) will be measured and evaluated

Applicants must also demonstrate:

  • value for money
  • commitment to sustainable development principles in project delivery
short_description: Aid organisations committed to helping communities bring about long term changes in lifestyle
contact_details: Environment Wales info@environment-wales.org 029 2043 1727 Baltic House Mount Stuart Square Cardiff CF10 5FH

title: Darwen Creates: Business Support and Advice
eligibility: The scheme focuses on young people and the wider community in Blackburn with Darwen but Darwen Creates are happy to work with people from outside of this area.
long_description: A business incubation centre designed to provide the space, support and advice needed when starting a business. From flexible office space to expert business advice the scheme can offer and signpost to a variety of services such as business advisers, mentoring, workshops and networking.
short_description: An incubation centre providing space, support and advice for people wanting to start a business
contact_details: Darwen Creates darwencreates@daca.uk.com 0125 4819 555 Darwen Aldridge Community Academy Sudell Road Darwen Lancashire BB3 3HD

title: Business Loan Fund - Gwynedd
eligibility:
The Fund will be available for businesses within the boundaries of the Gwynedd Council area. Every business should either have its operating centre or a substantial number of its permanent full-time workforce within the boundaries of Gwynedd

Evidence will be required that prospective clients have approached their bank in the first instance.
evaluation: Please see the website for details four the information that will be required to assess all loan applications.
long_description:
The Gwynedd Council Business Loan Fund has been established to provide finance to small and medium sized businesses (including social enterprises). The purpose of the loan is to establish or develop a business, and not to repay any existing debts or other loans.

The loan can be used as assistance towards the financing of working capital or capital expenditure.
short_description: Loan fund to establish or develop a business in Gywnedd
contact_details: Gwynedd County Council business@gwynedd.gov.uk 0128 667 9778 Council Offices Shirehall Street Caernarfon Gwynedd LL55 1SH

title: North Wales Coast Regeneration Area Community Fund
eligibility:
Community and voluntary groups, registered charities, town and community councils can apply.

Applications will be considered if:

  • the project is located within the area
  • permissions, planning, building regulations, and Listed Building Consents required for the project have been secured
  • alternative/additional forms of funding have been applied for

Projects should:

  • help to achieve the aims and objectives of the Regeneration Area
  • improve the viability of facilities
  • represent value for money
  • contribute to the Regeneration Area's vision
long_description:
This scheme provides funding for community capital projects.

The fund is to support capital projects, which create an asset which lasts several years, such as buying equipment, renovating a building or recreational area.

RWE npower renewables are providing funding for community benefit projects across parts of North Wales because of the Rhyl Flats Offshore Wind Farm.

The area stretches from Prestatyn in the East, to Mochdre in the West.

The RWE npower renewables part of this fund can support revenue funding. These are project running costs such as wages and advertising.
short_description: Funding for community projects with the North Wales Coast Regeneration Area
contact_details: Welsh Government 0300 062 5302 North Wales Coast Regeneration Area Sarn Mynach Llandudno Junction Conwy LL31 9RZ

title: Intensive Start-Up Support Programme - Oldham and Rochdale
eligibility: This programme is for businesses in Oldham and Rocahdale.
long_description:
This programme offers Black and Minority Ethnic (BME) businesses advice, workshops and training from initial concept through to business plan, set-up, trading and growth plan.

KYP can help with:

  • one to one support from qualified advisors
  • specialist training courses covering marketing, finance, tax, business planning, ecommerce, PR
  • funding search / raising finance /completion of applications
  • business plan preparation and cashflow forecasts
  • referral to support organisations and networks
  • Social Enterprise support and training
short_description: Business, employment and personal support services provided by accredited and experienced advisors
contact_details: KYP info@kyp.org.uk 0161 874 7389 Unique Enterprise Centre Belfield Road Rochdale Manchester OL16 2UP

title: Helping Your Business Grow Internationally
additional_information: Most support is available throughout the UK. Certain aspects of intensive assistance are for England only. The Devolved Administrations have comparable schemes. This product is open to all UK businesses and those that make a significant contribution to the UK economy. Some specific named programmes are only open to companies that meet the EU definition of an SME. Some aspects of the product are chargeable but at a subsidised rate.
long_description: The scheme provides structured help to prepare a business to start exporting, to improve their exporting capabilities and to help businesses enter new export markets or improve their position in existing markets.
short_description: Structured help to prepare a business with its exporting capabilities
contact_details: UK Trade & Investment 020 7215 8000 1 Victoria Street London SW1H 0ET

title: Budding Businesses Grant
additional_information:
Grant applications are considered regularly by the Caerffili Cwm a Mynydd Partnership.

This programme will run until September 2013.
eligibility:
The financial assistance is specifically aimed at micro-businesses in the rural wards of Caerphilly County Borough.

  • Please see the website for the list of wards that qualify for the grant as designated by the Welsh Assembly Government.
long_description: The Budding Businesses Grant can fund capital and revenue projects for developing new ideas and products in the areas of local food, timber, crafts and rural skills, new creative industries, marketing, promotion and fostering a local attitude.
short_description: For micro-businesses in the rural wards of Caerphilly County Borough
contact_details: Caerphilly County Borough Council countryside@caerphilly.gov.uk 0144 383 8632 Countryside and Landscape Services Pontllanfraith House Pontllanfraith Blackwood NP12 2YW

title: Community Economic Development Programme
additional_information: Funding applications are assessed up to three times per year, subject to the availability of resources.
eligibility: Funding is available to a wide range of organisations, that have ambitions to develop into economically sustainable organisations within the third sector i.e. voluntary and community organisations, charities, social enterprises, co-operatives and mutuals.
long_description: The purpose of the Community Economic Development Programme is to build sustainable and vibrant communities through the development of community economic activity and social enterprises. The funding is aimed at supporting and developing sustainability within the third sector, and reducing their reliance upon grant support.
short_description: Support for local enterprises in Caerphilly County Borough
contact_details: Caerphilly County Borough Council business@caerphilly.gov.uk 0144 386 6397 Economic Development Team Tredomen Business & Technology Tredomen Park Hengoed CF82 7FN

title: Invest in Nottingham
long_description:
Invest in Nottingham is the inward investment agency for Nottinghamshire.

They offer a range of services to businesses looking to relocate or expand in the city and county and their main aim is to create new jobs in the area.

The range of services include:

  • bespoke research and economic data
  • property solutions and location advice
  • recruitment and training support
  • relocation support for incoming employees
  • access to funding and incentives
  • linkages into business networks
organiser: Nottingham City Council and Nottinghamshire County Council
short_description: Support for businesses looking to expand or relocate in the Nottinghamshire area
will_continue_on: Nottingham City Council and Nottinghamshire County Council website
contact_details: Nottingham City Council and Nottinghamshire County Council enquiries@nottinghamcity.gov.uk 0115 876 4467 Loxley House Station Street Nottingham NG2 3NG

title: Sullay Jalloh Business Centre
additional_information: The project is part financed by the European Regional Development Fund.
eligibility:
• the office is not allowed to be used for retail purposes
  • application process applies
long_description:
The Sullay Jalloh Business Centre offers office accommodation for start-up and growing businesses in Nottingham.

The Centre aims to help businesses develop and grow during their stay by providing free business advice and support from First Enterprise.
short_description: Provides office accommodation in Nottingham for small businesses
contact_details: First Enterprise reception@first-enterprise.co.uk 0115 9789 057 82 - 84 Radford Road Hyson Green Nottingham NG7 5FU

title: IT Apprenticeship Graduates
additional_information: Zenos deliver training to people under the National Apprenticeship Service scheme funded by the Skills Funding Agency.
long_description:
The Zenos employment service provides a tailored means for employers to find work-ready, qualified and high quality IT staff.

The Zenos team works with business and other employer organisations of all sizes to understand their employment needs and then to create a solution that allows them to benefit from the supply of IT Apprenticeship graduates from the nationwide network of Zenos Academies.
short_description: Free service matching employers with IT apprenticeship graduates
contact_details: Zenos Academy enquiries@zenos.com 0845 055 6404 Aynhoe Park Aynho Banbury OX17 3BQ

title: Interactive Scotland
eligibility:
The service is open to Scottish businesses developing creative and digital media content, applications, products, services or platforms. Businesses in the following sectors can benefit from IS:

  • design/advertising
  • mobile phones
  • interactive software
  • internet
  • gaming
  • broadcast services
  • film
  • video production
  • exhibition services
  • next generation learning
  • music
  • publishing
long_description:
Interactive Scotland (IS) provides Scottish creative and digital media businesses with access to a unique specialist expert advice and support network, helping them develop new business models, innovative content, applications, products and services.

The service offers:

  • access to a range of IS and partner events, aimed at raising market awareness of the innovation and business opportunities across the creative and digital media sector
  • access to market intelligence and research either as an enquiry or through work with an IS adviser
  • one-to-one advisory support to help explore a particular issue/enquiry/development affecting your business growth. Support is subject to Scottish Enterprise approval
  • brokerage using IS connections to partners and links to other IS clients to help business development. Includes pitch preparations for partner meetings and funding/investment bids
short_description: Expert help and support for businesses across the digital media sector in Scotland
contact_details: Interactive Scotland info@interactivescotland.com 0845 604 6842 1 Ainslie Road Hillington Glasgow G52 4RU

title: Small Business Bonus Scheme - North Lanarkshire
eligibility:
Each individual property must have a rateable value of less than, or equal to, £18,000.

This scheme is aimed at businesses in North Lanarkshire only.
long_description: This scheme reduces the rates burden on small businesses who have a combined rateable value of £25,000 or less.
short_description: Provides business rates relief for small business in North Lanarkshire
contact_details: North Lanarkshire Council revenue@northlan.gov.uk 01698 403 903 Finance and Customer Services Dalziel Building 7 Scott Street Motherwell ML1 1SX

title: Small Business Bonus Scheme - South Lanarkshire
eligibility:
Each individual property must have a rateable value of less than, or equal to, £18,000.

This scheme is aimed at businesses in South Lanarkshire only.
long_description: This scheme reduces the rates burden on small businesses who have a combined rateable value of £25,000 or less.
short_description: Provides business rates relief for small business in South Lanarkshire
contact_details: South Lanarkshire Council rates@southlanarkshire.gov.uk 01698 453 240 Non-Domestic Rates Council Offices 1 Leechlee Road Hamilton ML3 0XJ

title: Millennium Awards
eligibility:
The awards are available to an individual or informal group over the age of 16 and living in Northern Ireland, with an idea for a venture that has social or environmental benefit.

The project must not be part of paid employment and the award cannot support constituted groups.

Applicants must:

  • have an idea that will benefit a community
  • have thought about how they will run the project
  • have some evidence that there is a need for your project
  • will learn a new skill from carrying out the project
long_description:
Unltd's Millennium Awards provide practical and financial support to social entrepreneurs in the UK.

Those who win an award will get a complete package of support designed specifically for them, in addition to the financial support.

There are two levels of awards:

  • level 1 awards are designed to help make new ideas become real projects. UnLtd gives out 1,000 level 1 awards each year across the UK. Level 1 Awards are aimed at individuals or informal groups of people who have an idea and want help getting it off the ground. The money is to help with the running costs of the project.
  • level 2 awards support people whose ideas are already developed or pay for the living expenses of award winners to help them devote more time to their projects. These awards are given out once in the spring and once in the autumn.
short_description: Practical and financial support for social entrepreneurs in the UK
contact_details: UnLtd info@unltd.org.uk 028 9024 4007 Northern Ireland Office Room 55-57 Scottish Mutual Building 16 Donegal Square South Belfast BT1 5JG

title: Springboard Growth Programme
long_description:
Springboard is a consortium of small business owners who have experience developing large and small businesses and assist businesses to grow through improved performance.

The Springboard Growth Programme provides an opportunity for businesses to work with Springboard to develop business needs.
short_description: Assists businesses to grow through improved performance
contact_details: Springboard 0173 782 4004 Robert Denholm House Bletchingley Road Nutfield Surrey RH1 4HW

title: Apprenticeship Training Agency - East of England
long_description:
The National Apprenticeship Service (NAS) has been working with a number of Apprenticeship Training Agencies (ATAs) to help develop a new approach to supporting employers who wish to recruit apprentices. The ATAs are specifically designed to support employers who wish to take on an apprentice but are unable to in the current economic climate. In particular they can support employers whose order book will not currently allow them to commit to employing an apprentice for the full period of the Apprenticeship, but know that they will need fully trained employees when the economy picks up.

The distinctive feature of the ATA model is that it is the ATA who acts as the apprentice employer and who places them with a host employer. The host employer pays the ATA a fee for the apprentices' services; this fee being based on the wage agreed with the host and the ATA management fee.

The ATA model offers other benefits for the employer. These include:

  • support with recruitment - finding the right apprentice to meet the employers' needs
  • responsibility for the wages, tax, National Insurance as well as administration and performance management
  • supervision of the apprentice during the Apprenticeship period
  • links with a approved training provider and support to both the apprentice and host employer throughout the Apprenticeship
short_description: Support for employers who wish to take on an apprentice
contact_details: Essex Works apprenticeships@essex.gov.uk 0124 543 8815 Essex County Council County Hall Market Road Chelmsford CM1 1QH

title: Apprenticeship Training Agency - National
long_description:
The National Apprenticeship Service (NAS) has been working with a number of Apprenticeship Training Agencies (ATAs) to help develop a new approach to supporting employers who wish to recruit apprentices. The ATAs are specifically designed to support employers who wish to take on an apprentice but are unable to in the current economic climate. In particular they can support employers whose order book will not currently allow them to commit to employing an apprentice for the full period of the Apprenticeship, but know that they will need fully trained employees when the economy picks up.

The distinctive feature of the ATA model is that it is the ATA who acts as the apprentice employer and who places them with a host employer. The host employer pays the ATA a fee for the apprentices' services; this fee being based on the wage agreed with the host and the ATA management fee.

The ATA model offers other benefits for the employer. These include:

  • support with recruitment - finding the right apprentice to meet the employers' needs
  • responsibility for the wages, tax, National Insurance as well as administration and performance management
  • supervision of the apprentice during the Apprenticeship period
  • links with a approved training provider and support to both the apprentice and host employer throughout the Apprenticeship
organiser: National Skills Academy for Creative and Cultural
short_description: Support for employers who wish to take on an apprentice
will_continue_on: National Skills Academy for Creative and Cultural website
contact_details: National Skills Academy for Creative and Cultural apprenticeships@ccskills.org.uk 020 7015 1840 Lafone House The Leathermarket Weston Street London SE1 3HN

title: Intensive Start-Up Support Programme
additional_information:
This programme offers successful applicants access to a qualified business adviser and business workshops which will provide comprehensive advice and guidance on all aspects of setting up and running a business.

Topics covered include:

  • business planning
  • marketing
  • networking
  • finance
  • sales
  • cashflow forecasting
  • VAT, tax and national insurance

Businesses which have been trading for less than 3 years are entitled to individual advice sessions and business workshops.
eligibility: This support is aimed at individuals who wish to start a business and companies who have been trading for less than 3 years.
long_description: This programme provides free business support and advice through group workshops and individual advice appointments.
short_description: Free business support and advice to new and potential businesses
contact_details: Orvia Enterprise ask@orvia.co.uk 01772 422 242 Centurion House Leyland Business Park Centurion Way Leyland PR25 3GR

title: Commercial Property Grant Scheme
additional_information: Funding for the scheme has been made available by the European Regional Development Fund through the Welsh Government and is part of a £3.2 million EU-backed scheme to revitalise and restore the rich heritage of Pembroke and Pembroke Dock.
long_description:
The Commercial Property Grant Scheme is available to property owners within the conservation areas of Pembroke and Pembroke Dock.

The grant can be obtained for external and internal structural and fabric repair and to restore architectural heritage detail.
short_description: Grant for owners of commercial properties in Pembroke and Pembroke Dock to restore architectural heritage
contact_details: Pembrokeshire County Council 01437 776 180 County Hall Haverfordwest Pembrokeshire SA61 1TP

title: Crofting Counties Agricultural Grants Scheme - Benbecula
eligibility: Please see the website for eligibility criteria.
long_description:
The Crofting Counties Agricultural Grants Scheme (CCAGS) provides assistance towards improving and sustaining the viability of croft business. In doing this it also helps achieve other benefits such as improved animal health and welfare.

The principle objective of CCAGS is to sustain the economic basis and way of life and so help retain population in crofting areas.

Support is available to eligible applicants for land improvement, agricultural buildings, access and facilities for keeping livestock.
organiser: Scottish Government Rural Payments and Inspections Directorate (SGRPID)
short_description: Grants for a range of crofting activities
will_continue_on: Scottish Government Rural Payments and Inspections Directorate (SGRPID) website
contact_details: Scottish Government Rural Payments and Inspections Directorate (SGRPID) SGRPID.Benbecula@scotland.gsi.gov.uk 0300 244 9600 Balivanich Isle of Benbecula HS7 5LA

title: Edinburgh World Heritage - Shopfront Improvement Grant
eligibility:
Organisations and individuals who own a historic building within the EWH Conservation Funding Programme Boundary are eligible to apply.

Please see website for details.
evaluation:
Examples of what the grant cannot fund are:

  • replacement of historic shopfronts with a modern design
  • routine maintenance and minor repairs
  • alterations and private interior work
  • demolitions
  • work already underway
long_description: The Edinburgh World Heritage (EWH) offers repayable interest-free grants as part of their Conservation Funding Programme. The Shopfront Improvement grant aims to enhance and restore shopfronts within the Edinburgh Conservation Funding Programme Boundary. This involves reinstating original architectural features.
short_description: Grants to enhance and restore shopfronts within the Edinburgh Conservation Funding Programme Boundary
contact_details: Edinburgh World Heritage info@ewht.org.uk 0131 220 7720 5 Charlotte Square Edinburgh EH2 4DR

title: Inventorium
long_description:
Inventorium is a action designed to bring together people who would not normally meet - people who each have a part but not the whole of an innovation.

The aim of Inventorium is to provide a mechanism for the generation of new ideas that will lead to the formation of new businesses or contribute to sustaining existing businesses, with particular focus on digital technologies for health, public services, education, leisure, tourism, culture, entertainment, environment and transport.

The scheme does this by a series of interlinked processes including:

  • developing and testing systematic methodologies for early stage knowledge interchange as part of the knowledge transfer process
  • supporting the early stage conceptualisation of products and services based on innovative technologies which in turn further builds capacity for research in those domains
  • providing channels of communication between potential and existing partners
  • providing mechanisms and supports for subsequent translational research and early stage business incubation
short_description: Generates ideas that lead to new businesses or help sustain existing ones
contact_details: Inventorium 01248 675013 CAST Ffordd Penlan Parc Menai Business Park Bangor Gwynedd LL57 4HJ

title: European Fisheries Fund Programme (Wales) (EFF) 2008 - 2013
long_description:
The European Fisheries Fund (EFF) is intended to promote a sustainable and profitable fisheries sector and support strong local fishing communities in line with the Wales Fisheries Strategy.

Funding focuses on the following four priority areas, in addition to technical assistance to facilitate delivery:

  • adaptations of the community fishing fleet
  • aquaculture, inland fishing, processing and marketing of fisheries and aquaculture products
  • measures of collective benefit
  • sustainable development of fisheries areas
  • sustainable development of fisheries areas
short_description: Grants to assist with capital investment in the aquaculture, fishing and fish processing industries
contact_details: EFF Projects Team EFFProjectsTeam@wales.gsi.gov.uk 0300 062 2184 Fisheries Unit Welsh Assembly Government Rhodfa Padarn Llanbadarn Fawr Aberystwyth SY23 3UR

title: Graduate Placement - Orkney
eligibility:
The graduate must be qualified to HND level or above and the employment must be:

  • the first since graduation
  • within 2 years of graduation
  • relevant to the qualification obtained
  • incorporated within a business plan
long_description: The Council can offer a grant of up to 25 per cent of the total wage and national insurance cost of a graduate trainee, up to a maximum of £5,000.
short_description: Grant of up to 25% for the total wage of a graduate trainee (up to a maximum of 5,000
contact_details: Business Gateway Orkney Business.gateway@orkney.gov.uk 01856 886 666 14 Queen Street Kirkwall Orkney KW15 1JE

title: Conwy Sustainable Resources Grant
additional_information: This grant is not available for solely domestic renewable energy installations.
eligibility: Projects of all scales will be considered, subject to meeting eligibility requirements. Projects which demonstrate partnership working and both wide support and benefits will be prioritised.
long_description: Grant support for community groups, farms and other businesses in rural Conwy that are interested in harnessing local sources of renewable energy. Assistance is available for those at all stages of local renewable energy projects.
short_description: Support in rural Conwy for community groups, farms or businesses interested in harnessing local sources of renewable energy
contact_details: Conwy Rural Partnership conwycynhaliol@conwy.gov.uk 01492 577837 Conwy Cynhaliol Glasdir Plas yn Dre Llanrwst LL26 0DF

title: Conwy Sustainable Resources Grant
eligibility: Proposals should demonstrate innovation or seek to develop new products to rural Conwy.
long_description: Grant support for developing the production, processing and marketing of locally grown produce. Funding may be offered for expert consultancy or the purchase of equipment.
short_description: Support for developing the production, processing and marketing of locally grown produce
contact_details: Conwy Rural Partnership conwycynhaliol@conwy.gov.uk 01492 577837 Conwy Cynhaliol Glasdir Plas yn Dre Llanrwst LL26 0DF

title: New Writers' Bursaries
additional_information: If you have had work published in anthologies and periodicals, please send samples with your application.
eligibility: At least 10,000 words of work-in-progress prose or 15 poems must be submitted with your application.
long_description: New Writers' Bursaries can be awarded to writers who have not previously published a volume of their work.
short_description: Bursaries for writers who've not previously published a volume of their work
contact_details: Literature Wales post@literaturewales.org 029 2047 2266 Mount Stuart House Mount Stuart Square Cardiff CF10 5FQ

title: Healthy Working Lives
additional_information: The Scottish Centre for Healthy Working Lives is part of the NHS and as such all these services are free and confidential.
eligibility: Small to medium-sized enterprises are eligible for occupational health and safety support.
long_description: This scheme provides free and confidential advice, workplace visits, training and support for Scottish businesses covering all aspects of health, safety and wellbeing in the workplace. All Scottish employers can access training and health improvement support from expert advisers and can register for the Healthy Working Lives award.
short_description: Free health, safety and wellbeing in the workplace support for Scottish businesses
contact_details: Healthy Working Lives adviceline@nhs.net 0800 019 2211 Princes Gate 3rd Floor Castle Street Hamilton ML3 6BU

title: Published Writers' Bursaries
additional_information: Please send one copy of a sample volume with your application. These will be returned if requested.
eligibility: At least 4,000 words of work-in-progress or eight poems must be submitted with your application.
long_description: Published Writers' Bursaries can be awarded to writers who have already published a volume or more of work.
short_description: Bursaries for writers who've already had their work published
contact_details: Literature Wales post@literaturewales.org 029 2047 2266 Mount Stuart House Mount Stuart Square Cardiff CF10 5FQ

title: Children's Writers' Bursaries
eligibility:
Applicants should provide a representative selection of the work-in-progress.

Educational materials, general non-fiction books and picture books for children are not eligible.
long_description:
Children's Writers' Bursaries are intended for writers for children and young people in Welsh and English.

Literature Wales is keen to encourage the following in particular:

  • English-language writers whose work has a Welsh background.
  • Writers producing longer novels in the Welsh language.
short_description: Bursaries for writers of Welsh and English children books
contact_details: Literature Wales post@literaturewales.org 029 2047 2266 Mount Stuart House Mount Stuart Square Cardiff CF10 5FQ

title: The Miscellaneous Fund
additional_information:
Capital grants, such as the purchasing of computers, are not available from this fund.

This Fund does not support:

  • photography
  • illustrations
  • website development
  • course fees
  • internet and phone costs
eligibility:
Applicants should supply detailed projected costs for travel or research.

Examples of eligible criteria include:

  • travel costs
  • research
  • work in other languages
  • childcare
long_description: The Miscellaneous Fund can offer support related to specific writing projects.
short_description: Small-scale support for specific writing projects
contact_details: Literature Wales post@literaturewales.org 029 2047 2266 Mount Stuart House Mount Stuart Square Cardiff CF10 5FQ

title: Enabling Bursaries for Disabled Writers
additional_information:
Examples can include aid for the following:

  • to purchase specialist equipment
  • to assist with particular travel costs
  • towards secretarial assistance such as editorial work, typing and printing

Literature Wales can also consider applications for assistance with other issues affecting disabled writers.
long_description: Enabling Bursaries for specialist equipment are awarded to assist disabled writers.
short_description: Specialist equipment bursaries to assist disabled writers
contact_details: Literature Wales post@literaturewales.org 029 2047 2266 Mount Stuart House Mount Stuart Square Cardiff CF10 5FQ

title: Asbestos Advisory Service - Northern Ireland
eligibility: Applicants must be based in Northern Ireland.
long_description: The scheme provides accurate information and best-practice guidance to help businesses deal with asbestos.
organiser: Health and Safety Executive for Northern Ireland
short_description: Information and guidance on working with asbestos
will_continue_on: Health and Safety Executive for Northern Ireland website
contact_details: Health and Safety Executive for Northern Ireland asbestos@detini.gov.uk 0800 0320 121 83 Ladas Drive Belfast BT6 9FR

title: Investors in People Scotland Impact Programme
additional_information: Training sessions will take place in Edinburgh, Glasgow or Aberdeen. They will be tailored to specific businesses or sectors.
eligibility: Scottish based, small or medium sized, privately owned businesses in the Scottish Enterprise region with less than 200 employees.
evaluation: The initial consultation is free and will determine whether the business is suited to the Impact Programme.
long_description: Eligible businesses will receive coaching and mentoring sessions to help them identify key objectives and challenges for their organisation.
short_description: Helps Scottish based businesses grow through mentoring sessions
contact_details: Investors In People (IIP) enquiries@iipscotland.co.uk 0131 625 0155 Ocean Point 1 94 Ocean Drive Edingburgh EH6 6JH

title: Innov8+
evaluation: Funding is subject to the client setting up business within Neath Port Talbot and successfully completing a recognised start up course.
long_description:
Neath Port Talbot Council's Innov8+ programme provides a range of support and advice on starting, developing and growing a business.

Support is available to help with:

  • access to start up workshops and courses designed to provide practical business skills training
  • a start up Information pack tailored to business needs
  • referral to practical workshops, seminars and support, for example bookkeeping, customer care skills, winning new business, once trading
  • ongoing mentoring for existing businesses
short_description: Support and advice on starting, developing and growing a business
will_continue_on: Neath Port Talbot County Council website
contact_details: Neath Port Talbot County Council innov8@npt.gov.uk 0163 9765 695 Sandfields Young Business Centre Port Talbot SA12 7PT

title: Graduate Recruitment and Placement (GRAP) Programme
eligibility:
The schemes is open to small and medium-sized businesses based in the North East.

Businesses in the following sectors cannot be supported:

  • leisure
  • farming and food production
  • personal services
  • transport
  • retail
long_description:
The scheme provides placement and knowledge exchanges for 12 weeks and 26 weeks. Shorter or longer placements will be considered where this suits the business better, as will the addition of academic expertise where businesses require a higher level of technical expertise.

This scheme supports North East businesses by identifying recent and mature graduates with industrial experience and relevant higher level skills, matching them with employment opportunities, and placing them with regional businesses.
short_description: Placements and internships for recent graduates in the North East of England
will_continue_on: Teesside University/European Regional Development Fund (ERDF) website
contact_details: Teesside University/European Regional Development Fund (ERDF) Emma.Detchon@tees.ac.uk 01642 384 036 Dept of Academic Enterprise Teesside University Borough Road Middlesbrough TS1 3BA

title: Mentor Scheme
long_description:
Businesses based in Bedfordshire and Hertfordshire can obtain support, advice and guidance from a fully trained business mentor. Businesses will be matched to a mentor with specific experience and knowledge in the relevant area. Available support includes:

  • an outside perspective on the business
  • confidential consultations about the business
  • assistance with decision making
  • unbiased advice
  • feedback with business ideas
  • assistance with decision making
  • contacts and networks to further business development
  • ongoing encouragement and support for your business
short_description: Up to 6 months free business support from an experienced business mentor
contact_details: Wenta admin@wenta.co.uk 0845 371 0891 The Wenta Business Centre Colne Way Watford Herts WD24 7ND

title: Social Enterprise Consultancy
long_description:
This scheme provides information on what is required to create a sustainable social enterprise and how to balance the need to generate income whilst retaining a social purpose. Support for social enterprises and the voluntary sector have included:

  • consulting on the setting up of workspace and conference facilities for social enterprise use
  • advising housing associations on how they may encourage tenants to consider starting a social enterprise as a means to employment and the facilities they may provide to facilitate this
short_description: Information on what's required to create a sustainable social enterprise
contact_details: Wenta admin@wenta.co.uk 0845 371 0891 The Wenta Business Centre Colne Way Watford Herts WD24 7ND

title: Early Stage Investment - Wales
eligibility:
Wales based businesses or businesses planning to establish a commercial presence in Wales.

Businesses whose main customers are the general public including retailers and nurseries will not qualify for investment.
long_description: Finance Wales invests in innovative early stage businesses with the ambition and potential to become international market leaders.
short_description: Invests in innovative early stage businesses
contact_details: Finance Wales 0800 587 4140 Oakleigh House Park Place Cardiff CF10 3DQ

title: Management Succession Funding - Wales
additional_information: Investment is not available for direct consumer businesses.
eligibility:
To be eligible for Investment, businesses should:

  • be located in wales
  • employ up to 250 people
  • have an annual turnover of less than €50 million
  • demonstrate a sound business plan
  • show genuine growth potential
long_description:
The management succession funding scheme provides investments for individuals looking to buy a Welsh business. This can enable a variety of targets including:

  • increasing profits
  • expanding into new markets
  • consolidating operations in Wales
short_description: Investments for those wanting to buy a Welsh business
contact_details: Finance Wales 029 2033 8100 Oakleigh House Park Place Cardiff CF10 3DQ

title: Development Capital - Wales
additional_information: Investments can range from £5,000 to £25,000. Amounts over £25,000 will require a 5 year business plan.
eligibility: Any growing business that meets the investment criteria can be eligible for development capital.
long_description:
This scheme aims to structure an investment package of either a loan, equity or a combination of both to help growing businesses overcome challenge such as:

  • expanding into new markets, developing a new sales channel or moving to bigger premises
short_description: Funding for growing businesses with proven success
contact_details: Finance Wales 0800 587 4140 Oakleigh House Park Place Cardiff CF10 3DQ

title: New Enterprise Start-Up Fund
additional_information:
The New Enterprise Start-Up Fund is not available to businesses in the retail sector or purely local services.

In all cases a fully documented application is required.
eligibility:
To be eligible for the New Enterprise Start-Up Fund businesses must:

  • have been trading for no more than two years
  • be able to produce a business plan with three year financial projections
  • have a business address
  • have fixed asset capital expenditure
  • create at least three jobs over a two year period
  • be receiving support from an appropriate business advisor
long_description:
The New Enterprise Start-Up Fund is designed to assist new start-up companies in Cardiff.

Financial assistance may be provided to companies meeting the eligibility criteria. In addition to financial assistance, advice can be provided at each stage of the investment process.
short_description: Funding to assist new start-up companies in Cardiff
contact_details: Cardiff Council businessadvice@cardiff.gov.uk 029 2087 3158 County Hall Atlantic Wharf Cardiff CF10 4UW

title: Capital Investment Fund
eligibility:
To be eligible for the capital investment fund companies must:

  • fall into the key economic sector
  • have a business address
long_description:
The Capital Investment Fund consists of loans and equity investment loans. It is provided for the following activities:

  • start-up growth businesses
  • established and expanding companies
  • high technology and knowledge based companies
  • companies demonstrating continuous improvement, competitiveness, innovation and creativity
  • businesses looking to undertake capital works to buildings
short_description: Loans and equity investments to businesses in Cardiff
contact_details: Cardiff Council businessadvice@cardiff.gov.uk 029 2087 3158 County Hall Atlantic Wharf Cardiff CF10 4UW

title: Invest Northern Ireland Start Up Advice-Western Region
additional_information: Through the Start Up advice and support, delegates will receive expert guidance essential in getting started.
long_description:
When starting a business in Northern Ireland, accessing Start Up advice and support is the way to go about it.

Invest NI provides advice and support dedicated to helping potential entrepreneurs think about, plan and launch their own businesses.

Key benefits include:

  • an initial one to one meeting to discuss ideas and provide an introduction to business planning
  • a business clinic focused on developing individual business plans
  • business planning one to one session to review and finalise business plans
short_description: Advice and support on starting a business in Northern Ireland
contact_details: Invest Northern Ireland (NI) 0800 027 0639 Western Regional Office Kevlin Buildings 47 Kevlin Avenue Omagh BT78 1ER

title: Invest Northern Ireland Start Up Advice-North East Region
additional_information: Through the Start Up advice and support, delegates will receive expert guidance essential in getting started.
long_description:
When starting a business in Northern Ireland, accessing Start Up advice and support is the way to go about it.

Invest NI provides advice and support dedicated to helping potential entrepreneurs think about, plan and launch their own businesses.

Key benefits include:

  • an initial one to one meeting to discuss ideas and provide an introduction to business planning
  • a business clinic focused on developing individual business plans
  • business planning one to one session to review and finalise business plans
short_description: Advice and support on starting a business in Northern Ireland
contact_details: Invest Northern Ireland (NI) 0800 027 0639 North Eastern Regional office Thomas House 32E Thomas Street Ballymena BT43 6AX

additional_information: Through the Start Up advice and support, delegates will receive expert guidance essential in getting started.
long_description:
When starting a business in Northern Ireland, accessing Start Up advice and support is the way to go about it.

Invest NI provides advice and support dedicated to helping potential entrepreneurs think about, plan and launch their own businesses.

Key benefits include:

  • an initial one to one meeting to discuss ideas and provide an introduction to business planning
  • a business clinic focused on developing individual business plans
  • business planning one to one session to review and finalise business plans

additional_information: Through the Start Up advice and support, delegates will receive expert guidance essential in getting started.
long_description:
When starting a business in Northern Ireland, accessing Start Up advice and support is the way to go about it.

Invest NI provides advice and support dedicated to helping potential entrepreneurs think about, plan and launch their own businesses.

Key benefits include:

  • an initial one to one meeting to discuss ideas and provide an introduction to business planning
  • a business clinic focused on developing individual business plans
  • business planning one to one session to review and finalise business plans
short_description: Advice and support on starting a business in Northern Ireland
contact_details: Invest Northern Ireland (NI) so@investni.com 0800 027 0639 Southern Regional office Drumalane Mill The Quays Newry Co. Down BT35 8QS

title: Invest Northern Ireland Start Up Advice-Eastern Region
additional_information: Through the Start Up advice and support, delegates will receive expert guidance essential in getting started.
long_description:
When starting a business in Northern Ireland, accessing Start Up advice and support is the way to go about it.

Invest NI provides advice and support dedicated to helping potential entrepreneurs think about, plan and launch their own businesses.

Key benefits include:

  • an initial one to one meeting to discuss ideas and provide an introduction to business planning
  • a business clinic focused on developing individual business plans
  • business planning one to one session to review and finalise business plans
short_description: Advice and support on starting a business in Northern Ireland
contact_details: Invest Northern Ireland (NI) eo@investni.com 0800 027 0639 Eastern Regional office Bedford Square Bedford Street Belfast BT2 7ES

title: Learndirect - England, Wales and Northern Ireland
long_description: Learndirect offers information and advice about training and qualifications. Its website features an online portfolio of courses and support facilities for both businesses and individuals.
short_description: Advice on training and a variety of courses
contact_details: Ufi/Learndirect enquiries@learndirect.net 0800 101 901 PO Box 900 Leicester LE1 6ER

title: Connect Midlands
eligibility:
This scheme is suitable for:

  • businesses whose business activities embrace technology for competitive advantage
  • businesses dependant on applying scientific and technological skills or knowledge
long_description: Connect Midlands is a not-for-profit network, that supports technology and high-growth companies to gain investment through training and mentoring, investment showcasing, and networking between businesses, investors and the professional services community in the Midlands.
short_description: Assists new and growing-technology enterprises
contact_details: Connect Midlands info@connectmidlands.org 02476 323 320 The Venture Centre Sir William Lyons Road Coventry Warwickshire CV4 7EZ

title: Finance Yorkshire - Business Loans
eligibility:
Businesses that are eligible will be:

  • a small or medium-sized enterprise paying business rates in the Yorkshire and Humber region or those wishing to re-locate
  • an early stage, established or growing business
  • a manufacturing or service sector business (some restrictions apply)
  • a revenue generating business which can demonstrate the ability to service the proposed loan repayments from the outset
  • a business with growth potential
  • have a gap in funding where conventional sources of finance are insufficient or unavailable
long_description:
This scheme provides loans for businesses who have been unable to acquire funding from traditional sources.

Finance Yorkshire business loans are available for a wide range of purposes including working capital, expansion projects, commercial premises and asset acquisitions.
short_description: Loans for businesses that have been unable to receive funding from traditional sources
contact_details: Finance Yorkshire info@finance-yorkshire.com 0845 649 0000 1 Capitol Court Capitol Business Park Dodworth Barnsley S75 3TZ

title: Research and Development Tax Credit for Small and Medium-Sized Enterprises (SMEs) - Cambridge
additional_information:
Some SMEs which are not in profit can surrender their research and development tax losses for cash, if they have paid PAYE/National Insurance during the year.

The Cambridge office covers applications from parts of North London, Hertfordshire, Cambridgeshire, Suffolk, Norfolk, Bedfordshire, Lincolnshire and Northamptonshire. For full details of postcodes covered please see the website.
eligibility:
The applicant must:

  • be involved in a project which is seeking to advance science or technology through the resolution of scientific or technological uncertainty
  • spend over £10,000 per year on research and development
evaluation: Companies should refer to the information provided on the HM Revenue & Customs website and contact their local tax office for advice.
long_description: This scheme offers extra tax deductions to small or medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) involved in research and development.
short_description: Tax deductions to SMEs carrying out research and development projects
contact_details: HM Revenue & Customs 01223 442 486 Eastbrook Shaftsbury Road Cambridge CB2 2DJ

title: WRAP
eligibility: All businesses within the UK may apply.
long_description:
WRAP offers confidential advice and support on environmental issues. This assistance enables companies to increase profitability and reduce environmental impact. The assistance provided includes:

  • an advice line
  • an informative website with downloadable publications and interactive tools
  • seminars and exhibitions
  • case studies and best practice guides
short_description: Confidential advice and support on environmental issues
contact_details: WRAP 0808 100 2040 The Old Academy 21 Horse Fair Banbury Oxon OX16 0AH

title: Medilink - East Midlands
additional_information: Medilink East Midlands makes up part of Medilink UK; a national network of similar minded organisations working to support the healthcare industry.
eligibility: Available to all sectors of the healthcare community based in the East Midlands, encompassing industry, universities and the NHS.
long_description:
Specialist support is available to assist the bioscience and healthcare community in the East Midlands. Membership services include:

  • commercial opportunities
  • networking events
  • access to a specialist healthcare information resource centre
  • access to a specialist regional healthcare web portal
  • training programme
  • regular newsletters and bulletins
short_description: Added value opportunities and services for East Midlands bioscience and healthcare SMEs
contact_details: Medilink East Midlands info@medilinkem.com 0115 912 4330 BioCity Nottingham Pennyfoot Street Nottingham England NG1 1GF

title: EV Tech Fund - North of England
additional_information: The fund works closely with other organisations to identify suitable investments, and takes an advisory role in the company's development.
eligibility:
Eligible businesses must be located in the North of England.

The market size for the product should be greater than £100 million.
long_description: The EV Tech Fund provides start up and early stage venture capital funding of typically £30,000 to £2 million to technology companies located throughout the UK, at the seed or start-up phase, and will also invest at the proof of concept stage. Eligible companies will have the potential to grow quickly to exploit global market opportunities, be able to illustrate substantial differential advantage and have exceptional commercial prospects.
short_description: Equity finance to early stage technology businesses
contact_details: Enterprise Ventures Limited info@evgroup.uk.com 01772 270 570 Preston Technology Management Ctr Marsh Lane Lancashire England PR1 8UQ

title: Knowledge Transfer Partnerships (KTP)
additional_information:
KTP projects are determined by the need of the business, are strategic in nature and at the heart of the business' development. The new capability sought is embedded into the business by one or more individuals, recruited for the purpose, working with staff in the company on the strategic project.

KTP projects may transfer some recent research, a technology, manufacturing technique, management process or technique, design capability so as to enable the business compete more effectively in world markets. These techniques may be leading edge or well established in one sector but new to another.

Products and services in the Solutions for Business portfolio are designed to help qualifying businesses grow and succeed.
eligibility:
Joint applications involving a higher or further education institution, public or private research organisations in partnership with business are considered for approval (see website).

Organisations in most sectors can participate as the business partner, including those in the third sector.
long_description:
Businesses and enterprises of all sizes, with the potential to grow, can participate in a Solutions for Business Knowledge Transfer Partnership (KTP).

Businesses can benefit from the expertise of higher education academics, tutors in further education colleges or researchers in a research-based organisation (the knowledge base partner) to develop a new capability in the business.
organiser: Knowledge Transfer Partnerships Technology Strategy Board
short_description: Uses expertise in UK universities, colleges and research organisations to help businesses develop
will_continue_on: Knowledge Transfer Partnerships Technology Strategy Board website
contact_details: Knowledge Transfer Partnerships Technology Strategy Board KTP_Companies@tsb.gov.uk 0300 321 4357 North Star House North Star Avenue Swindon SN2 1UE

title: Step Programme
long_description: The Step Programme provides a summer placement programme for undergraduates studying full time at UK Universities. Placements are generally in small businesses where delegates undertake a specific piece of work of real benefit to the host company.
short_description: Support for businesses taking undergraduates for summer placements
contact_details: Step Enterprise House employers@step.org.uk 0844 2488 242 14 - 16 Bridgford Road West Bridgford Nottingham NG2 6AB

title: National Advice Service
eligibility: The service is available free to all businesses throughout the UK.
long_description:
Businesses can access free and professional advice on a wide range of topics. The service can address enquiries regarding:

  • aggregates levy
  • air passenger duty
  • climate change levy
  • customs
  • excise
  • insurance premium tax
  • landfill tax
  • money laundering regulations
  • rebated oils
  • value added tax
short_description: Advice on general enquiries for taxes and financial regulations
contact_details: HM Revenue & Customs 0845 010 9000 62-70 Deansgate Tettenhall Road Wolverhampton WV1 4TZ

title: Annual Accounting Scheme
long_description: This scheme helps to spread the cost of VAT by making nine equal monthly instalments with a balance of payment made in the tenth month. Eligible businesses also gain an extra month in which to submit the VAT return.
short_description: Assists businesses with spreading the cost of VAT
contact_details: HM Revenue & Customs 0845 010 9000 Annual Accounting Imperial House 77 Victoria Street Grimsby DN31 1DB

title: Flat Rate Scheme for Small Businesses
eligibility: UK businesses with an annual taxable turnover, excluding VAT, of no greater than £150,000 may apply.
long_description: Businesses based in the UK can access a unique service designed to simplify their VAT calculations. Instead of keeping an input and output account, this service allows applicants to pay VAT as a percentage of their turnover instead of having to work out and record the VAT on all sales and purchases.
short_description: Simplified accounting of VAT to businesses based in the UK
contact_details: HM Revenue & Customs 0845 010 9000 Imperial House 77 Victoria Street Grimsby DN31 1DB

title: Enterprise Management Incentives
eligibility: Companies and employees must fulfil the Enterprise Management Incentive conditions to be eligible. Further information is available on the website.
long_description: This scheme can provide tax-advantaged share options designed to help small higher risk companies recruit and retain employees with the skills that will help them grow and succeed. They are also designed to reward employees for investing their time and skills in helping small companies achieve their potential.
short_description: Tax advantaged share options to company employees (in certain conditions)
contact_details: HM Revenue & Customs enterprise.centre@hmrc.gsi.gov.uk 0115 974 1250 Small Company Enterprise Centre 1st Floor Ferrers House Castle Meadow Road Nottingham NG2 1BB

title: Women in Rural Enterprise (WiRE)
eligibility: Membership is open to all women running or interested in starting a rural enterprise.
long_description: Business club designed to help women with all aspects of starting and maintaining their own rural enterprise. Members can attend regular networking events and seminars throughout the UK, and access information via newsletters and the website.
short_description: Support for women to establish and maintain their own rural enterprise
contact_details: Women in Rural Enterprise info@wireuk.org 01952 815 338 Harper Adams University Edgmond Newport Shropshire England TF10 8NB

title: Women Into the Network (WIN) - North East
eligibility: The main focus is on the North East of England, but members are welcome to join from anywhere in the UK or beyond.
long_description:
Women Into the Network aims to support, connect and promote their members by providing personalised and practical services, creating useful introductions and connections, and representing business needs on a regional and national stage.

This project aims to help networks of businesswomen to develop, and to bridge the gap between companies and providers of business and professional support. WIN's activities include:

  • releasing communications and publications
  • organising networking events
  • recognising female entrepreneurs at awards ceremonies
  • promoting role models
  • undertaking research into gender issues in business
short_description: Services for women who want to set up a business as well as those who already have
contact_details: Women Into the Network info@womenintothenetwork.co.uk 0845 269 9862 Design Works Williams Street Felling Gateshead NE10 0JP

title: Women's Business Development Agency
eligibility: Women based in the West Midlands and South West regions of England may apply.
long_description: The Women's Business Development Agency provides business support, advice and training to female entrepreneurs in the West Midlands and South West regions of England.
short_description: Business support, advice and training for women in the West Midlands and South West regions of England
contact_details: Women's Business Development Agency admin@wbda.co.uk 02476 236 111 The Enterprise Centre Coventry University Technology Park Puma Way Coventry CV1 2TT

title: British Overseas Industrial Placement (BOND)
additional_information: The host organisation pays an agreed monthly stipend for the professional, together with a modest monthly management fee to cover British Council costs. Home Office and Work Permits UK fees are passed on at cost.
eligibility: UK businesses in the industrial and commercial sectors may take part in the scheme.
long_description:
This scheme provides UK businesses with low-cost introductions to potential business partners in key developing international markets.

High quality professionals are matched with the requirements of UK businesses and assigned to work in the UK on placements for up to 12 months.
short_description: Matches businesses wishing to establish trading relationships in international markets with experienced professionals
contact_details: British Council (Manchester) bond@britishcouncil.org 0131 524 5747 Bridgewater House 58 Whitworth Street Manchester M1 6BB

title: Environmental Stewardship (ES) - England
eligibility: The scheme is open to farmers and land managers throughout England. Each element of the scheme has different qualifying requirements.
long_description:
This scheme provides funding to farmers and other land managers in England who deliver effective environmental management. The primary objectives of the programme are to:

  • conserve wildlife (biodiversity)
  • maintain and enhance landscape quality and character
  • protect the historic environment and natural resources
  • promote public access and understanding of the countryside
  • protect natural resources
short_description: Funding for effective environmental management of farmland
contact_details: Natural England enquiries@naturalengland.org.uk 0300 060 0011 1 East Parade Sheffield S1 2ET

title: Archaeological Fund - Orkney
additional_information: The Development Committee consider applications annually at its January meeting. Applications must be submitted before the end of November.
eligibility: Applicants must be based in the Orkney Islands.
long_description: The scheme provides financial assistance to help with the development of archaeological projects.
short_description: Grants to help with the development of archaeological projects
contact_details: Business Gateway Orkney Business.gateway@orkney.gov.uk 01856 886 666 14 Queen Street Kirkwall Orkney KW15 1JE

title: Rural Shops Improvement Scheme - Orkney
eligibility:
A general store or qualifying food shop will be considered eligible if a range of goods, including basic foodstuffs and household goods is offered for sale.

Assistance up to the £10,000 ceiling may be reached over the duration of the scheme either as a single aware towards one major project or accumulated over the course of several smaller awards.

Shops in Kirkwall may not apply.
long_description: General stores and qualifying food shops based outside the main population centre of Kirkwall can obtain financial support to assist them in funding improvements to their enterprise and their premises. The scheme is designed to ensure that local businesses continue to provide valuable services.
short_description: Financial support to general stores based in rural areas to fund a range of improvements
contact_details: Business Gateway Orkney Business.gateway@orkney.gov.uk 01856 886 666 14 Queen Street Kirkwall Orkney KW15 1JE

title: Start-up Support - Wales
eligibility: Applicants must be based in Wales.
long_description:
The scheme provides a range of support services to help early stage and start-up businesses, this includes help with:

  • market research and marketing strategies
  • business operations and costing and pricing
  • financial planning and book keeping
short_description: Support services for start-up businesses
contact_details: Business in Focus enquiries@businessinfocus.co.uk 0870 950 90 90 Enterprise House 127 Bute Street Cardiff Bay CF10 5LE

title: Film Agency - Wales
eligibility: Applicants must be based in Wales.
long_description:
The scheme provides a range of support services to film makers based in Wales. It covers:

  • film development
  • production
  • exhibition
  • education
short_description: Support for film makers in Wales
contact_details: Arts Council of Wales enquiries@filmagencywales.com 02920 467 480 Suite 7 33-35 West Bute Street Cardiff CF10 5LH

title: Management and Leadership Development Programme - Northern Ireland
additional_information: Individuals can only apply for a bursary twice in any 12 month period.
eligibility: Applicants must be managers and leaders in Northern Ireland.
long_description: This scheme offers a bursary to help managers who wish to participate in the Management and Leadership Development Programme. The Programme aims to offer Northern Ireland's managers a range of individual management development activities, each of which attracts bursary support.
short_description: Bursary for managers to take part in a skills development programme
will_continue_on: Department for Employment and Learning website
contact_details: Department for Employment and Learning 028 9090 5336 Adelaide House 39-49 Adelaide Street Belfast BT2 8FD

title: Skills for Small Business - Glasgow
eligibility: Businesses must be based in Glasgow and have fewer than 50 employees.
long_description: The scheme allows businesses to increase workforce skill levels using a planned and continuous training and development strategy. In addition, assistance is provided in the form of advice, training and grants.
short_description: Grants for skills-development programmes

title: Tree Planting and Landscape Grant - South Gloucestershire
additional_information: Grant aid is not available for commercial use of trees or for work carried out as a condition of planning consent.
eligibility:
Projects must be located in publicly visible sites in South Gloucestershire.

Planting or works must be carried out within one year.

Applicants must protect, maintain and replace trees for three years after planting.

Maximum area of tree planting site is 0.25 hectares.
evaluation: Where more than one application is made in a period of three financial years, the applicant must submit a landscape strategy masterplan for all the land in their ownership.
long_description: Individuals and organisations can receive a grant for projects that conserve and enhance the landscape character of the area through the planting of trees and other works.
